1.verse: The conception and birth of John the Baptist. The conception of Christ. The thankful songs of Mary and Zacharias. Since many have taken in hand to compile an account of those things that are known for certain among us,

2.verse: as told to us by those who were eyewitnesses from the beginning, and ministered at the doing of them,

3.verse: I determined also that, as soon as I had searched out diligently all things from the beginning, then I would write to you, good Theophilus,

4.verse: so that you may know the certainty of those things of which you are informed.

5.verse: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the shift of Abijah. And his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

6.verse: Both were perfect before God, and walked in all the laws and observances of the Lord, and no man could find fault with them.

7.verse: And they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and both were well stricken in age.

8.verse: And it came to pass as he executed the priest’s office before God, when his shift came

9.verse: according to the custom of the priest’s office, the lot fell to him to burn incense. And he went into the temple of the Lord,

10.verse: and the whole host of the people were outside in prayer while the incense was a-burning.

11.verse: And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

12.verse: And when Zacharias saw him, he was startled, and fear came on him.

13.verse: And the angel said to him, Fear not, Zacharias, for your prayer is heard. And your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.

14.verse: And you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.

15.verse: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink. And he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even in his mother’s womb.

16.verse: And he will turn many of the children of Israel to their Lord God.

17.verse: And he will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the unbelievers to the wisdom of the just men: to make the people ready for the Lord.

18.verse: And Zacharias said to the angel, How may I be sure of this, seeing that I am old, and my wife well stricken in years?

19.verse: And the angel answered and said to him, I am Gabriel who stands in the presence of God, and have been sent to speak to you and to show you these glad tidings.

20.verse: And behold, you shall be dumb and not able to speak until the time that these things are performed, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their season.

21.verse: And the people waited for Zacharias, and wondered that he was so long in the temple.

22.verse: And when he came out, he could not speak to them, whereby they perceived that he had seen some vision in the temple. And he gestured to them and remained speechless.

23.verse: And eventually, as soon as the time of his ministration was up, he departed home to his own house.

24.verse: And after those days, his wife Elizabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,

25.verse: Thus has God dealt with me in the days when he looked on me, to take from me the disgrace that I suffered among men.

26.verse: In the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth,

27.verse: to a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin’s name was Mary.

28.verse: And the angel went in to her and said, Hail, thou full of grace! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women.

29.verse: When she saw him, she was bewildered at his words, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this could be.

30.verse: And the angel said to her, Fear not, Mary, for you have found grace with God.

31.verse: Lo, you shall conceive in your womb, and shall bear a son, and shall call his name Jesus.

32.verse: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest. And the Lord God will give to him the seat of his father David,

33.verse: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom shall be no end.

34.verse: Then said Mary to the angel, How will this be, seeing I do not know a man?

35.verse: And the angel answered and said to her, The Holy Spirit shall come upon you, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow you. Therefore also, that holy thing which will be born of you will be called the Son of God.

36.verse: And behold: your cousin Elizabeth, she has also conceived a son in her old age. And this is her sixth month, though she be called barren.

37.verse: For with God, nothing is impossible.

38.verse: And Mary said, Behold the handmaiden of the Lord! Be it unto me even as you have said.  And the angel departed from her.

39.verse: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the mountains with haste, into a town of Judea,

40.verse: and entered into the house of Zacharias, and greeted Elizabeth.

41.verse: And it happened, as Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the babe sprang in her belly. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,

42.verse: and cried out with a loud voice and said, Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

43.verse: And how does it happen that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

44.verse: For lo, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe sprang in my belly for joy.

45.verse: And blessed are you who believed, for those things will be performed that were told you from the Lord.

46.verse: And Mary said, My soul does magnify the Lord,

47.verse: and my spirit rejoices in God my saviour.

48.verse: For he has looked on the poor degree of his handmaiden. Behold, now from henceforth all generations will call me blessed.

49.verse: For he who is mighty has done great things unto me, and holy is his name.

50.verse: And his mercy is on them who fear him, throughout all generations.

51.verse: He shows strength with his arm. He scatters those who are proud in the imagination of their hearts.

52.verse: He puts down the mighty from their seats and exalts those of low degree.

53.verse: He fills the hungry with good things and sends the rich away empty.

54.verse: He remembers mercy and helps his servant Israel,

55.verse: even as he promised to our fathers, to Abraham and to his seed forever.

56.verse: And Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months, and returned again to her own house.

57.verse: Elizabeth’s time came to be delivered, and she brought forth a son.

58.verse: And her neighbours and her relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy upon her, and they rejoiced with her.

59.verse: And when it was the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child, and were calling him by the name Zacharias, after his father.

60.verse: However his mother spoke and said, Not so, but he shall be called John.

61.verse: And they said to her, There is no one in your family called by this name.

62.verse: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

63.verse: And he asked for writing tablets and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they all marvelled.

64.verse: And Zacharias’ mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue also, and he spoke, lauding God.

65.verse: And awe came on all those who dwelt near to them. And also these stories were spread abroad throughout all the hill country of Judea,

66.verse: and everyone who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, What manner of child will this be? And the hand of the Lord was with him.

67.verse: And his father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,

68.verse: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for he has visited and redeemed his people.

69.verse: And he has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,

70.verse: just as he promised by the mouth of his holy prophets, who have been since the world began:

71.verse: that we would be saved from our enemies and from the hands of all who hate us,

72.verse: to fulfil the mercy promised to our fathers, to remember his holy covenant,

73.verse: and to perform the oath that he swore to our father Abraham,

74.verse: to give us, so that we, delivered out of the hands of our enemies, might serve him without fear all the days of our life,

75.verse: in such holiness and righteousness as are accepted before him.

76.verse: And thou, child, shall be called the prophet of the Highest. For you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,

77.verse: and to give knowledge of salvation to his people for the remission of sins,

78.verse: through the tender mercy of our God, whereby the Dayspring from on high has visited us,

79.verse: to give light to those who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, and to guide our feet into the way of peace.

80.verse: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and was out in the wilderness till the day came when he was to show himself to the Israelites.

1.verse: The birth and circumcision of Christ. How he was received into the temple. How Simeon and Anna prophesy of him, and how he was found in the temple among the learned instructors of the Jews. And it happened in those days that there went out a commandment from Augustus the Emperor that all the world should be taxed.

2.verse: And this taxing was the first, and executed when Quirinius was governor in Syria.

3.verse: And every man went to his own town to be taxed.

4.verse: And Joseph also ascended from Galilee out of a town called Nazareth, into Judea to the city of David which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David,

5.verse: to be taxed with Mary, his espoused wife, who was with child.

6.verse: And it came to pass while they were there that her time came to be delivered.

7.verse: And she brought forth her first begotten son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger because there was no room for them within the inn.

8.verse: And there were in the same region shepherds abiding in the field and watching their flock by night.

9.verse: And lo, the angel of the Lord stood right by them, and the brightness of the Lord shone round about them, and they were very afraid.

10.verse: But the angel said to them, Be not afraid. For behold, I bring you tidings of great joy, which will come to all the people.

11.verse: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a saviour, who is Christ the Lord.

12.verse: And take this for a sign: you will find the child swaddled and laid in a manger.

13.verse: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of heavenly soldiers, lauding God and saying,

14.verse: Glory be to God on high, and peace on earth, and to men rejoicing.

15.verse: And it so was, as soon as the angels had gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, Let us go straight to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has shown to us.

16.verse: And they went with haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the babe laid in a manger.

17.verse: And when they had seen this, they proclaimed everywhere the message that had been given them concerning that child.

18.verse: And all who heard it wondered at those things the shepherds told them.

19.verse: But Mary laid up all those sayings, and pondered them in her heart.

20.verse: And the shepherds returned, praising and lauding God for all that they had heard and seen, even as it had been told to them.

21.verse: And when the eighth day came and the child was to be circumcised, his name was called Jesus, which was the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

22.verse: And when the time of their purification according to the law of Moses came, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord

23.verse: (as it is written in the law of the Lord: every man-child that first opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord),

24.verse: and to offer (as it is said in the law of the Lord) a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.

25.verse: And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. And the same man was just, and feared God, and longed for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was in him.

26.verse: And a revelation had been given him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

27.verse: And he came by inspiration into the temple. And when the father and mother brought in the child Jesus, to do for him according to the custom of the law,

28.verse: then he took him up in his arms and said,

29.verse: Lord, now let your servant depart in peace according to your promise.

30.verse: For my eyes have seen the saviour sent from you,

31.verse: whom you have prepared before the face of all people –

32.verse: a light to give sight to the Gentiles, and the glory of your people Israel.

33.verse: And his father and mother marvelled at those things that were spoken of him.

34.verse: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother, Behold, this child shall be the fall and the resurrection of many in Israel, and a sign that shall be spoken against.

35.verse: And moreover, the sword will pierce your soul, so that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.

36.verse: And there was a prophetess, one Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,

37.verse: and been a widow for about eighty-four years. She never went out of the temple, but served God with fasting and prayer night and day.

38.verse: And she came forth also that same hour, and praised the Lord, and spoke of him to all who looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

39.verse: And as soon as they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee to their own town, Nazareth.

40.verse: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was with him.

41.verse: Now his father and mother went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the Passover.

42.verse: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast.

43.verse: And when the days had come to an end, as they turned back for home, the child Jesus remained still in Jerusalem, unbeknownst to his father and mother.

44.verse: For they supposed he would be with the caravan. And therefore they went a day’s journey, and were searching for him among their kinsfolk and companions.

45.verse: When they did not find him, they went back again to Jerusalem and searched for him.

46.verse: And eventually, after three days, they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both listening to them and asking them questions.

47.verse: And everyone who heard him marvelled at his understanding and answers.

48.verse: When his parents saw him, they were astonished. And his mother said to him, Son, why have you dealt with us this way? Look, your father and I have been searching for you, sorrowing.

49.verse: And he said to them, How is it that you were searching for me? Did you not know that I must go about my Father’s business?

50.verse: But they did not understand what he was saying to them.

51.verse: And he went with them, and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them. And his mother kept all these things in her heart.

52.verse: And Jesus increased in wisdom and age, and in favour with God and man.

1.verse: The preaching, baptism, and imprisonment of John. The baptism of Christ. A recital of the lineage of the fathers. In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius the Emperor (Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch in Iturea and in the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene),

2.verse: when Annas and Caiaphas were the high priests, the word of God came to John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.

3.verse: And he came into all the country about the Jordan River preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins,

4.verse: as it is written in the book of the sayings of Isaiah the prophet, which says: The voice of a crier in the wilderness: Prepare ye the way of the Lord; make his paths straight!

5.verse: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low. And crooked things shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth.

6.verse: And all flesh shall see the saviour sent by God.

7.verse: Then he said to the people who came to be baptized by him, O offspring of vipers, who has taught you to flee from the wrath to come?

8.verse: Bring forth the due fruits of repentance, and do not begin to say in yourselves, We have Abraham for our father. For I say to you, God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

9.verse: And now also is the axe laid to the root of the trees, so that every tree that does not bring forth good fruit shall be hewn down and cast into the fire.

10.verse: And the people asked him, saying, What should we do then?

11.verse: He answered and said to them, He who has two coats, let him share with him who has none; and he who has food, let him do likewise.

12.verse: Then there came publicans to be baptized, who asked him, Master, what should we do?

13.verse: And he said to them, Require no more than that which is appointed to you.

14.verse: The soldiers likewise enquired of him, saying, And what should we do? And he said to them, Do violence to no man, neither trouble any man wrongfully, but be content with your wages.

15.verse: And as the people were in expectation, and all musing in their hearts about John, whether he was the Christ,

16.verse: John answered and said to them all, I baptize you with water, but one stronger than I is coming after me, whose shoe latchet I am not worthy to loose. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

17.verse: He has his fan in his hand, and will purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but the chaff he will burn with fire that never shall be quenched.

18.verse: And with many other exhortations, John preached to the people.

19.verse: Then Herod the tetrarch (when he was rebuked by him concerning Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils that Herod had done)

20.verse: added this above all, and shut up John in prison.

21.verse: And it came to pass, as all the people were receiving baptism, and when Jesus was baptized and did pray, that heaven was opened,

22.verse: and the Holy Spirit came down in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven saying, You are my dear Son; in you I do delight.

23.verse: And Jesus himself was about thirty years of age when he began, being as men supposed the son of Joseph, who was the son of Heli,

24.verse: who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi, who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Janna, who was the son of Joseph,

25.verse: who was the son of Mattathiah, who was the son of Amos, who was the son of Nahum, who was the son of Esli, who was the son of Naggai,

26.verse: who was the son of Maath,  who was the son of Mattathiah, who was the son of Semei, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Judah,

27.verse: who was the son of Joannas, who was the son of Rhesa, who was the son of Zerubbabel, who was the son of Shealtiel, who was the son of Neri,

28.verse: who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Addi, who was the son of Cosam, who was the son of Elmodam, who was the son of Er,

29.verse: who was the son of Jose, who was the son of Eliezer, who was the son of Jorim, who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi,

30.verse: who was the son of Simeon, who was the son of Judah, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Jonan, who was the son of Eliakim,

31.verse: who was the son of  Melea, who was the son of Menan, who was the son of Mattathah, who was the son of Nathan, who was the son of David,

32.verse: who was the son of Jesse, who was the son of Obed, who was the son of Boaz, who was the son of Salmon, who was the son of Nahshon,

33.verse: who was the son of Amminadab, who was the son of Ram, who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez, who was the son of Judah,

34.verse: who was the son of Jacob, who was the son of Isaac, who was the son of Abraham, who was the son of Terah, who was the son of Nahor,

35.verse: who was the son of Serug, who was the son of Reu, who was the son of Peleg, who was the son of Eber, who was the son of Shelah,

36.verse: who was the son of Cainan, who was the son of Arphaxad, who was the son of Shem, who was the son of Noah, who was the son of Lamech,

37.verse: who was the son of Methuselah, who was the son of Enoch, who was the son of Jared, who was the son of Mahalalel, who was the son of Cainan,

38.verse: who was the son of Enos, who was the son of Seth, who was the son of Adam, who was the son of God.

1.verse: Jesus is led into the wilderness and fasts all the time of his temptation. He overcomes the devil, and goes into Galilee to preach. At Nazareth the Jews despise him. In Capernaum the devils recognize and identify him, he enters Peter’s house and heals his mother-in-law, and does great miracles. Jesus, then full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was carried by the Spirit

2.verse: into the wilderness, and was for forty days tempted by the devil. And during those days he ate nothing. And when they were ended, he was afterwards hungered.

3.verse: And the devil said to him, If you are the Son of God, command this stone to be made bread.

4.verse: And Jesus answered him, saying, It is written: Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.

5.verse: And the devil took him up into a high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, even in the twinkling of an eye.

6.verse: And the devil said to him, All this power I will give you, every whit, and the glory of these kingdoms. For it has been delivered to me, and to whomever I wish, I give it.

7.verse: If you therefore will worship me, they shall all be yours.

8.verse: Jesus answered him and said, Away from me, Satan! For it is written: You shall honour the Lord your God, and him only serve.

9.verse: And the devil carried him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple and said to him, If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here.

10.verse: For it is written: He will give his angels charge over you, to keep you,

11.verse: and with their hands they will hold you up so that you do not dash your foot against a stone.

12.verse: Jesus answered and said to him, It is said: You shall not tempt the Lord your God.

13.verse: And as soon as the devil had ended all his temptations, he departed from him for a season.

14.verse: Jesus returned by the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and there went a renown of him throughout all the region round about.

15.verse: And he taught in their synagogues, and was commended by all.

16.verse: And he went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and as his custom was, went into the synagogue on the Sabbath days, and stood up to read.

17.verse: And there was delivered to him the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when he had opened the scroll, he found the place where it was written:

18.verse: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me. To preach the gospel to the poor he has sent me, and to heal the broken-hearted; to preach deliverance to the captive, and sight to the blind, and freely to set at liberty those who are bruised,

19.verse: and to preach the favoured year of the Lord.

20.verse: And he rolled up the scroll and returned it to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him.

21.verse: And he began and said to them, This day this scripture is fulfilled in your ears.

22.verse: And they all witnessed him, and wondered at the gracious words that proceeded out of his mouth, and said, Is this not Joseph’s son?

23.verse: And he said to them, You may very well say to me this maxim: Physician, heal thyself; the things that we heard were done in Capernaum, do the same here likewise in your own country.

24.verse: And he said, Truly I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country.

25.verse: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when heaven was shut for three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;

26.verse: but to none of them was Elijah sent save into Sarepta, a city of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.

27.verse: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and yet none of them was healed except Naaman of Syria.

28.verse: And as many as were in the synagogue, when they heard that, were filled with wrath.

29.verse: And they rose up and thrust him out of the city, and led him even to the edge of the hill on which their town was built, to cast him down headlong.

30.verse: But he went his way even through the midst of them,

31.verse: and descended into Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and there taught them on the Sabbath days.

32.verse: And they were astonished at his instruction, for his preaching was with power.

33.verse: And in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean devil, who cried with a loud voice, saying,

34.verse: Let me alone! What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you, who you are: even the Holy One of God.

35.verse: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold your peace and come out of him! And the devil threw the man in the midst of them and came out of him, and did not hurt him.

36.verse: And fear came on them all, and they spoke among themselves, saying, What manner of thing is this? For with authority and power he commands the foul spirits, and they come out.

37.verse: And the news of him spread abroad through all places of the country round about.

38.verse: And he rose up and departed from the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. And Simon’s mother-in-law was taken with a great fever, and they made intercession to him for her.

39.verse: And he stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and ministered to them.

40.verse: When the sun was down, all the people that had sick folk taken with different diseases brought them to him, and he laid his hands on every one of them and healed them.

41.verse: And devils also came out of many of them, crying out and saying, You are Christ, the Son of God! But he rebuked the devils, and would not permit them to speak, for they knew that he was Christ.

42.verse: As soon as it was day, he departed and went away into an isolated place. And the people sought him out and came to him, and kept him from leaving them.

43.verse: But he said to them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other places also, for that is why I have been sent.

44.verse: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

1.verse: Christ preaches in the boat. The disciples leave everything and follow him. He cleanses the leper, heals the paralytic, calls Matthew, the customs officer, and eats with open sinners. It came to pass, as the people pressed in upon him to hear the word of God, that he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret

2.verse: and saw two boats standing by the lake side. But the fishermen were gone out of them and were washing their nets.

3.verse: And he entered into one of the boats, which belonged to Simon, and asked him to thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down and taught the people out of the boat.

4.verse: When he had left speaking, he said to Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let slip your nets to make a catch.

5.verse: And Simon answered and said to him, Master, we have laboured all night and have caught nothing. But at your word, I will loose forth the net.

6.verse: And when they had so done, they netted a great multitude of fishes. And their net was tearing,

7.verse: but they made signs to their fellow fishermen who were in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they were sinking back.

8.verse: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Lord, go from me, for I am a sinful man.

9.verse: For he was utterly astonished, as was everyone with him, at the haul of fish that they took;

10.verse: and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, Fear not; from henceforth you shall catch men.

11.verse: And they brought the boats to land, and left everything, and followed him.

12.verse: And it happened, as he was in a certain town, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. And when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and besought him, saying, Lord, if you will, you can make me clean.

13.verse: And Jesus stretched forth his hand and touched him, saying, I will; be clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

14.verse: And Jesus told him not to tell anyone, but to go and show himself to the priest, and to make an offering for his cleansing, as Moses had commanded, for a witness to them.

15.verse: But word of him went abroad all the more, and crowds of people came together to hear him and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

16.verse: And he kept himself apart in the remote places, and gave himself to prayer.

17.verse: And it happened on a certain day that he was teaching, and there sat the Pharisees and doctors of the law, who had come out of all the towns of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was to heal the people.

18.verse: And behold, some men brought a man lying in his bed, who was taken with paralysis, and were trying to find a way to bring him in and to lay him before Jesus.

19.verse: And when they could not find a way to bring him in, because of the press of people, they went up on the top of the house and let him down through the tiling, bed and all, in the midst before Jesus.

20.verse: When he saw their faith, he said to him, Man, your sins are forgiven you.

21.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to think, saying, What fellow is this, who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins, but God only?

22.verse: When Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answered and said to them, What are you thinking in your hearts?

23.verse: Which is easier to say: Your sins are forgiven you, or to say, Rise and walk?

24.verse: But so that you may know that the Son of man has power to forgive sins on earth – He said to the paralytic, I say to you, arise; take up your bed and go home to your house.

25.verse: And immediately he rose up before them, took up the bed he laid on, and departed to his own house, praising God.

26.verse: And they were all amazed, and they lauded God and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things today.

27.verse: And after that, Jesus went out and saw a publican named Levi sitting at the receipt of custom, and said to him, Follow me.

28.verse: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

29.verse: And that same Levi gave for Jesus a great feast at home in his own house. And there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat at food with him.

30.verse: And the scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do you eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

31.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, The whole have no need for the physician, but the sick do.

32.verse: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.

33.verse: Then they said to him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and pray, and the disciples of the Pharisees also, but yours eat and drink?

34.verse: And he said to them, Can you make the children of the wedding fast while the bridegroom is present with them?

35.verse: The days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast, in those days.

36.verse: Then he spoke to them in a similitude: No one patches a piece of a new garment into an old vesture, because if he does, then he will have cut up the new, and the piece that was taken out of the new does not agree with the old.

37.verse: Also, no one pours new wine into old wineskins, because if he does, the new wine bursts the vessels and runs out, and the vessels are destroyed.

38.verse: But new wine must be poured into new vessels, and both are preserved.

39.verse: Also, no one who drinks old wine can straightaway abide the new, for he says the old is pleasanter.

1.verse: He defends the disciples that pluck the ears of grain. He heals the man with the withered hand, chooses his twelve apostles, gives a sweet sermon, and teaches to do good for evil. It happened on an after-Sabbath that Jesus went through the grain field, and his disciples plucked the ears of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.

2.verse: And certain of the Pharisees said to them, Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?

3.verse: And Jesus answered them and said, Have you not read what David did when he himself was hungry, and those who were with him?

4.verse: How he went into the house of God, and took and ate the loaves of hallowed bread, and gave also to those who were with him – which bread it was not lawful to eat, but for the priests only?

5.verse: And he said to them, The Son of man is Lord of the Sabbath day.

6.verse: And it came about in another Sabbath also that he entered into the synagogue and taught. And there was there a man whose right hand was withered.

7.verse: And the scribes and Pharisees watched Jesus to see if he would heal on the Sabbath day, to find an accusation against him.

8.verse: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man that had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stepped forth.

9.verse: Then Jesus said to them, I will ask you a question: whether it is lawful on the Sabbath days to do good, or to do evil; to save life, or to destroy it?

10.verse: And he looked around at them all and said to the man, Stretch forth your hand. And he did so, and his hand was restored and made as whole as the other.

11.verse: And they were filled full of madness, and conferred with each other, what they might do to Jesus.

12.verse: And it came to pass in those days that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

13.verse: And as soon as it was day, he called his disciples. And of them he chose twelve, whom he also called apostles:

14.verse: Simon, whom he named Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew;

15.verse: Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alpheus, and Simon called Zelotes;

16.verse: Judas, James’ son; and Judas Iscariot, which same was the traitor.

17.verse: And he came down with them, and stood in the open field with the company of his disciples and a great crowd of people out of all parts of Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases,

18.verse: and people also who were vexed with foul spirits, and they were healed.

19.verse: And all the people pressed in to touch him, because power went out of him and healed them all.

20.verse: And he lifted up his eyes upon the disciples and said, Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

21.verse: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

22.verse: Blessed are you when men hate you and thrust you out of their company, and rail, and abhor your name as an evil thing, for the Son of man’s sake.

23.verse: Rejoice then, and be glad, for behold, your reward is great in heaven. Likewise did their fathers treat the prophets.

24.verse: But woe is to you who are rich, for you have therein your consolation.

25.verse: Woe to you who are full, for you shall hunger. Woe to you who now laugh, for you will wail and weep.

26.verse: Woe to you when all men praise you, for likewise did their fathers praise the false prophets.

27.verse: But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.

28.verse: Bless those who curse you, and pray for those who wrongfully trouble you.

29.verse: And to him that strikes you on the one cheek, offer also the other. And him that takes away your gown, forbid not to take your coat also.

30.verse: Give to every man that asks of you. And of him who takes away your goods, ask not for them back.

31.verse: And as you would have others do unto you, so do unto them likewise.

32.verse: If you love those who love you, what credit are you worthy of? For the very sinners love their friends.

33.verse: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit are you worthy of? For the very sinners do even the same.

34.verse: If you lend to people from whom you hope to receive, what credit should you have? For the very sinners lend to sinners, to receive as much in return.

35.verse: Therefore love your enemies, do good, and lend, looking for nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be the children of the Highest. For he is kind to the unkind and to the evil.

36.verse: Be therefore merciful, as your Father is merciful.

37.verse: Judge not, and you will not be judged. Condemn not, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

38.verse: Give, and it will be given to you: a good measure pressed down, shaken together, and running over will men give into your bosoms. For the measure that you use will be measured back to you.

39.verse: And he put forth a similitude to them: Can the blind lead the blind? Do they not both then fall into the ditch?

40.verse: The disciple is not above his master, but everyone will be formed even as his teacher is.

41.verse: Why do you see a speck in your brother’s eye, and not consider the beam that is in your own eye?

42.verse: Or how can you say to your brother, Brother, let me pull out the speck that is in your eye – when you do not perceive the beam that is in your own eye? Hypocrite! First cast the beam out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to pull the speck out of your brother’s eye.

43.verse: It is not a good tree that brings forth bad fruit, nor is that a bad tree that brings forth good fruit.

44.verse: For every tree is known by its fruit. Neither is it from thorns that men gather figs, nor from bushes that they gather grapes.

45.verse: A good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth that which is good. And an evil man, out of the evil treasure of his heart, brings forth that which is evil. For out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.

46.verse: Why do you call me Master, Master, and yet not do as I bid you?

47.verse: Whoever comes to me and hears my sayings and does them, I will show you whom he is like:

48.verse: he is like a man who built a house, and dug deep, and laid the foundation on a rock. When the waters rose, the flood beat upon that house, and could not move it. For it was grounded upon a rock.

49.verse: But the person who hears and does not is like a man who built a house without a foundation upon the soil, against which the flood beat, and it fell immediately. And the fall of that house was great.

1.verse: He heals the centurion’s servant, raises up the widow’s son from death to life, and answers the disciples that John the Baptist sent to him. He commends John, and reproves the Jews for their unfaithfulness. He eats with the Pharisee. The woman washes his feet with her tears, and he forgives her her sins. When Jesus had ended all his sayings in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

2.verse: And a certain centurion’s servant was sick and ready to die, whom he made much of.

3.verse: And when the centurion heard of Jesus, he sent to him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him to come and heal his servant.

4.verse: And they came to Jesus and besought him urgently, saying, He is worthy that you should do this for him,

5.verse: for he loves our nation, and has built us a synagogue.

6.verse: And Jesus went with them. And when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy that you should come under my roof.

7.verse: Therefore I did not think myself worthy to come to you. But speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

8.verse: For I likewise am a man under authority, and have under me soldiers. And I say to one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my servant, Do this, and he does it.

9.verse: When Jesus heard this, he marvelled at him, and turned about and said to the people that followed him, I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.

10.verse: And those who had been sent turned back home again, and found the servant that had been sick, whole.

11.verse: And it happened after that, that he went into a town called Nain. And many of his disciples went with him, and crowds of people.

12.verse: When he came near to the gate of the town, behold, there was a dead man being carried out. He had been the only son of his mother, and she was a widow, and a large group of townsfolk were with her.

13.verse: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her and said to her, Weep not.

14.verse: And he went and touched the bier, and those who were bearing it stood still. And he said, Young man, I say to you, arise.

15.verse: And the dead man sat up and began to speak. And Jesus delivered him to his mother.

16.verse: And there came a fear upon them all. And they glorified God, saying, A great prophet is risen among us, and God has visited his people.

17.verse: And this talk of him went forth throughout all Judea, and throughout all the regions that lie round about.

18.verse: And the disciples of John reported to him about all these things.

19.verse: And John called to him two of his disciples and sent them to Jesus, saying, Are you he that was to come, or should we look for another?

20.verse: When the men came to Jesus, they said, John the Baptist sent us to you, saying, Are you he that was to come, or should we wait for another?

21.verse: And at that same time, Jesus cured many people of their infirmities and diseases, and of evil spirits; and to many who were blind, he gave sight.

22.verse: And Jesus answered and said to John’s disciples, Go your ways and tell John what things you have seen and heard – how the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead arise. To the poor, the glad tidings are preached;

23.verse: and happy is he who is not offended by me.

24.verse: When the messengers of John had departed, Jesus began to speak to the people about John. What did you go out into the wilderness to see? Did you go to see a reed shaken with the wind?

25.verse: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, those who are gorgeously apparelled and live delicately are in kings’ courts.

26.verse: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

27.verse: This is he of whom it is written: Behold, I send my messenger before your face, to prepare your way before you.

28.verse: For I say to you, among the children of women there is no greater prophet than John. Nevertheless, one who is less in the kingdom of God, is greater than he.

29.verse: And all the people who heard, and the publicans, justified God, and were baptized with the baptism of John.

30.verse: But the Pharisees and scribes rejected the counsel of God against themselves, and were not baptized by him.

31.verse: And the Lord said, To what shall I liken the people of this generation, and what are they like?

32.verse: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped to you, and you have not danced; we have mourned to you, and you have not wept.

33.verse: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say he has the devil.

34.verse: The Son of man has come, and eats and drinks, and you say, Here is a man who is a glutton and a drinker of wine, a friend of publicans and sinners.

35.verse: Yet wisdom is justified by her children.

36.verse: And one of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee’s house and sat down to food.

37.verse: And behold, a woman in that town who was a sinner, as soon as she knew that Jesus sat at food in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of oyntment.

38.verse: And she stood at his feet behind him, weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with oyntment.

39.verse: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he spoke within himself, saying, If this man were a prophet, he would surely know who and what manner of woman this is that touches him; for she is a sinner.

40.verse: And Jesus responded and said to him, Simon, I have something to say to you. And he said, Teacher, say on.

41.verse: There was a certain lender who had two debtors. One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

42.verse: When they had nothing to pay, he forgave them both. Which of them, tell me, will love him most?

43.verse: Simon answered and said, I suppose the one that was forgiven most. And he said to him, You have truly judged.

44.verse: And Jesus turned to the woman and said to Simon, Do you see this woman? I entered into your house and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has washed my feet with tears and wiped them with the hair of her head.

45.verse: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

46.verse: My head with oil you did not anoint, but she has anointed my feet with oyntment.

47.verse: Therefore I say to you, many sins are forgiven her, for she loved much. But he who is forgiven less, loves less.

48.verse: And he said to her, Your sins are forgiven you.

49.verse: And those who sat at food with him began to say within themselves, Who is this, who forgives sins in this way?

50.verse: And he said to the woman, Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.

1.verse: Christ, with his apostles, goes from town to town and preaches, explains the parable of the seed, says who is his mother and his brother, and stills the raging of the sea. He delivers the possessed man and drives the devils into the herd of swine, and helps the sick woman and Jairus’ daughter. And it happened after that, that he went throughout cities and towns, preaching and proclaiming the kingdom of God. And the twelve were with him,

2.verse: and also certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils,

3.verse: and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered to them from their substance.

4.verse: When crowds of people were gathered together, having come to him out of all places, he spoke by a similitude:

5.verse: A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside, and it was trodden under foot, and the fowls of the air devoured it up.

6.verse: And some fell on stone, and as soon as it had sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

7.verse: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up with it and choked it.

8.verse: And some fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bore fruit a hundredfold. And as he said these things, he called: He who has ears to hear, let him hear!

9.verse: His disciples asked him, saying, What manner of similitude is this?

10.verse: And he said, To you it is given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God. But to others they remain in similitudes, so that when they see, they will not see, and when they hear, they will not understand.

11.verse: The similitude is this: The seed is the word of God.

12.verse: Those who are beside the way are the people that hear, but afterward the devil comes and takes away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.

13.verse: Those on the stones are people who, when they hear, receive the word with joy. But these have no roots, and for a while believe, but in time of trial go away.

14.verse: As for that which fell among thorns, this is those who hear and go forth, but are choked with cares, and with riches and voluptuous living, and bring forth no fruit.

15.verse: As for that in the good ground, this is those who with a good and pure heart hear the word, and keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.

16.verse: No man lights a candle and covers it under a vessel, neither puts it under the table, but sets it on a candlestick, so that those who enter in may see the light.

17.verse: Nothing is in secret that may not become clear, nor anything hid that may not be known and come to light.

18.verse: Take heed therefore how you hear. For whosoever has, to him will be given, and whosoever has not, from him shall be taken even that same which he supposes that he has.

19.verse: Then Jesus’ mother and his brethren came looking for him, but could not come in to him because of the press of people.

20.verse: And they told him, saying, Your mother and your brethren are standing outside and want to see you.

21.verse: He answered and said to them, My mother and my brethren are these who hear the word of God and do it.

22.verse: And it happened on a certain day that he got into a boat, and his disciples also, and he said to them, Let us go over to the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.

23.verse: And as they sailed, he fell asleep. And there arose a storm of wind on the lake, and they were filled with water and were in jeopardy.

24.verse: And the disciples went to him and awoke him, saying, Master, Master, we are lost! Then he arose and rebuked the wind and the tempest of water, and they ceased, and it became calm.

25.verse: And he said to them, Where is your faith? They feared and wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this? For he commands both the winds and water, and they obey him.

26.verse: And they sailed to the region of the Gadarenes, which is across from Galilee.

27.verse: And as he went out to land, there met him a certain man from the place, who had for a long time had a devil. And he wore no clothes; neither did he live in a house, but among graves.

28.verse: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with you, Jesus, Son of the God Most High? I beseech you, torment me not!

29.verse: For Jesus commanded the foul spirit to come out of the man. For it often affected him violently, and he was bound with chains and kept with shackles, but he broke the bonds, and was carried by the fiend into wilderness areas.

30.verse: And Jesus asked him, saying, What is your name? And he said, Legion (because many devils were entered into him).

31.verse: And the devils besought Jesus not to command them to go out into the deep.

32.verse: There was nearby a herd of many swine feeding on a hill, and the devils besought him to suffer them to enter into the swine. And he suffered them.

33.verse: Then the devils went out of the man and entered into the swine. And the herd took their course and ran headlong into the lake, and were drowned.

34.verse: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the town and in the villages.

35.verse: And people came out to see what had been done, and came to Jesus, and found the man out of whom the devils were departed sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

36.verse: Those also who had witnessed it told them how the demon-possessed man was healed.

37.verse: And all the whole population from the country of the Gadarenes besought Jesus to depart from them, for they were taken with great fear. And he got into the boat and turned back again.

38.verse: Then the man from whom the devils were departed asked him if he could be with him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,

39.verse: Go home again into your own house, and show what great things God has done for you. And the man went his way, and preached throughout all the city about the great things Jesus had done for him.

40.verse: And it came to pass that, when Jesus arrived back again, the people received him gladly, for they were all awaiting him.

41.verse: And behold, there came a man named Jairus (and he was a leader of the synagogue), and he fell down at Jesus’ feet and besought him to come to his house.

42.verse: For he had but a daughter only, about twelve years of age, and she lay dying. And as he went, the people thronged him.

43.verse: And a woman who had for twelve years had an issue of blood (who had spent all her substance on physicians, but could not be helped by any)

44.verse: came behind him and touched the hem of his garment, and immediately her issue of blood was stanched.

45.verse: And Jesus said, Who is it that touched me? When everyone denied it, Peter and those who were with him said, Master, the people throng you and crowd you, and you say, Who touched me?

46.verse: And Jesus said, Somebody touched me. For I can tell that power has gone out of me.

47.verse: When the woman saw that she was not hid, she came trembling and fell at his feet, and told him before all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

48.verse: And he said to her, Daughter, be of good comfort. Your faith has made you whole. Go in peace.

49.verse: While he was yet speaking, a person from the house of the synagogue leader came and said to him, Your daughter is dead; don’t trouble the Master.

50.verse: When Jesus heard that, he spoke to the father, saying, Fear not; only believe, and she shall be made whole.

51.verse: And when he came to the house, he allowed no one to go in with him except Peter, James, and John, and the father and the mother of the maiden.

52.verse: Everybody wept and sorrowed for her. And he said, Weep not, for she is not dead, but sleeping.

53.verse: And they laughed him to scorn, because they knew that she was dead.

54.verse: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand and called, saying, Maiden, arise!

55.verse: And her spirit came back, and she rose up straightaway. And he said to give her food.

56.verse: And her father and mother were astonished. But he charged them to tell no one what had been done.

1.verse: He sends out the twelve apostles to preach. Herod hears about him. He feeds 5,000 men with five loaves and two fishes. The disciples confess him to be the Son of God. He transfigures himself upon the mount, delivers the possessed, and teaches his disciples to be lowly. They desire vengeance, but he reproves them. Then he called the twelve together and gave them power and authority over all devils, and to heal diseases.

2.verse: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to cure the sick.

3.verse: And he said to them, Take nothing to support you along the way; neither staff nor bag, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats.

4.verse: And whatever house you enter into, there make your stay, and from there take your leave.

5.verse: And whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet, for a testimony against them.

6.verse: And they went out, and went through the towns preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.

7.verse: And Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Jesus, and was disconcerted because it was said by some that John was risen again from death,

8.verse: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by some that one of the old prophets was risen up again.

9.verse: And Herod said, John I have beheaded; who then is this of whom I hear such things? And he desired to see him.

10.verse: And the apostles returned and told Jesus what great things they had done. And he took them and went aside into a solitary place near to a town called Bethsaida.

11.verse: But the people knew of it, and followed him. And he received them, and spoke to them of the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.

12.verse: And when the day began to wear away, then the twelve came and said to him, Send the people away, so that they can go into the towns and villages round about and find lodging and get food, for we are in a remote place here.

13.verse: But he said to them, You give them to eat. And they said, We have no more than five loaves and two fishes, unless we go and buy food for all these people.

14.verse: And there were about 5,000 men. And he said to his disciples, Have them sit down in groups of fifty.

15.verse: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

16.verse: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looked up to heaven, and blessed them, and broke, and gave to the disciples to set before the people.

17.verse: And they ate and were all satisfied. And there were taken up of what remained to them twelve baskets full of leftovers.

18.verse: And it so was, as he was apart praying, that his disciples were with him, and he asked them, saying, Who do the people say I am?

19.verse: They answered and said, John the Baptist, or some say Elijah, and some say one of the old prophets is risen again.

20.verse: He said to them, Who do you say that I am? Peter answered and said, You are the Christ of God.

21.verse: And Jesus warned and instructed them that they should tell no one this thing,

22.verse: saying that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be reproved by the elders and by the high priests and scribes, and be slain, and the third day rise again.

23.verse: And he said to them all, if any person would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily and follow me.

24.verse: Whosoever would save his life shall lose it, but whosoever loses his life for my sake, he will save it.

25.verse: For what does it profit a man to win the whole world, if he loses himself, or runs in harm’s way?

26.verse: For whoever is ashamed of me and of my sayings, of him will the Son of man be ashamed when he comes in his own glory, and in the glory of his Father, and of the holy angels.

27.verse: And I tell you truly, there are some standing here who will not taste of death till they see the kingdom of God.

28.verse: And it followed about eight days after those sayings that Jesus took Peter, James, and John, and went up into a mountain to pray.

29.verse: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was changed, and his garment was white and shone.

30.verse: And behold, two men talked with him; and they were Moses and Elijah,

31.verse: who appeared gloriously, and spoke of his departing from this life, which he was to carry through to the end at Jerusalem.

32.verse: Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep. And when they awoke, they saw his glory, and two men standing with him.

33.verse: And as the men were departing from him, Peter said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us, being here. Let us make three tabernacles: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah. But he did not know what he was saying.

34.verse: While he thus spoke, there came a cloud that covered them, and they were afraid when they came under the cloud.

35.verse: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my dear Son. Hear him!

36.verse: And as soon as the voice was past, Jesus was found alone. And they kept it close, and told no one in those days any of those things that they had seen.

37.verse: And the next day, as they came down from the hill, a large crowd met him.

38.verse: And a man from the crowd cried out, saying, Teacher, I beg you, look upon my son, for he is all that I have.

39.verse: And see, a spirit takes him, and suddenly he shouts out. And it tears him so that he foams at the mouth, and with much pain departs from him when he has battered him.

40.verse: And I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.

41.verse: Jesus answered and said, O generation without faith and perverse, how long shall I be with you and suffer you? Bring your son here.

42.verse: And as the boy was yet coming, the fiend rent him and tore him.

43.verse: And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and delivered him to his father. And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. While everyone marvelled at all the things that he did, he said to his disciples,

44.verse: Let these words sink down into your ears: the time will come when the Son of man will be delivered into the hands of men.

45.verse: But they did not comprehend what that saying meant. It was hid from them, so that they did not understand it. And they were afraid to ask him about it.

46.verse: Then there arose a dispute among them, who should be the greatest.

47.verse: When Jesus perceived the thoughts of their hearts, he took a child and set him close by himself

48.verse: and said to them, Whoever receives this child in my name, receives me. And whoever receives me, receives him who sent me. For he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.

49.verse: And John answered and said, Master, we saw a man casting out devils in your name, and we told him not to, because he does not follow with us.

50.verse: And Jesus said to him, Forbid him not. For whoever is not against us, is with us.

51.verse: And it followed, when the time was come that he should be received up, then he set his face to go to Jerusalem, and sent messengers before him.

52.verse: And they went and entered into a city of the Samaritans, to make ready for him.

53.verse: But the Samaritans would not receive him, because his face was set toward Jerusalem.

54.verse: When his disciples James and John saw that, they said, Lord, would you have us call fire down from heaven to consume them, even as Elijah did?

55.verse: Jesus turned about and rebuked them, saying, You know not what manner of spirit you are of. The Son of man has not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.

56.verse: And they set off for another town.

57.verse: And as he walked in the road, a certain man said to him, I will follow you wherever you go.

58.verse: Jesus said to him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of man has nowhere to lay his head.

59.verse: And he said to another, Follow me. And the man said, Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.

60.verse: Jesus said to him, Let the dead bury their dead; but as for you, go and preach the kingdom of God.

61.verse: And another said, I will follow you, Lord, but let me first go and bid farewell to the people who are at home at my house.

62.verse: Jesus said to him, No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.

1.verse: He sends the seventy on before him to preach, and instructs them how to conduct themselves. He prays to his heavenly Father, answers the scribe that tested him, and by the example of the Samaritan, shows who is our neighbour. Martha receives the Lord into her house. Mary Magdalene is fervent in hearing his word. After these things, the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two by two before him into every city and place where he himself would come.

2.verse: And he said to them, The harvest is great, but the labourers are few. Pray therefore the Lord of the harvest to send forth labourers into his harvest.

3.verse: Go your ways. Behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

4.verse: Carry no wallet, nor bag, nor shoes, and address no man by the way.

5.verse: Into whatever house you enter, first say, Peace be to this house.

6.verse: And if a child of peace be there, your peace will rest upon him; if not, it will return to you again.

7.verse: And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they have. For the labourer is worthy of his reward. Go not from house to house.

8.verse: And into whatever town you enter, if they receive you, eat such things as are set before you,

9.verse: and heal the sick that are there, and say to them, The kingdom of God is come nigh upon you!

10.verse: But into whatever town you enter, if they do not receive you, go your ways out into the streets of the same and say,

11.verse: Even the very dust that cleaves on us from your city, we wipe off against you. But yet mark this, that the kingdom of God came nigh upon you.

12.verse: Yea and I say to you that it shall be easier in that day for Sodom than for that town.

13.verse: Woe is to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles had been done in Tyre and Sidon that have been done in you, they would have repented a great while ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

14.verse: But it will be easier for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.

15.verse: And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be thrust down to hell.

16.verse: He who hears you, hears me; and he who rejects you, rejects me; and he who rejects me, rejects him who sent me.

17.verse: And the seventy returned back again with joy, saying, Lord, even the very devils are subject to us through your name!

18.verse: And he said to them, I saw Satan, like lightning as it were, fall down from heaven.

19.verse: Behold, I give to you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all manner of power of the enemy, and nothing shall hurt you.

20.verse: Nevertheless, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are under your power, but rejoice because your names are written in heaven.

21.verse: At the same time, Jesus rejoiced in the Spirit and said, I confess unto you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hid these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to the babes. Even so, Father, for so pleased it you.

22.verse: All things are given me by my Father. And no man knows who the Son is except the Father, nor who the Father is except the Son, and the person to whom the Son will show him.

23.verse: And he turned to his disciples and said privately, Happy are the eyes that see what you see.

24.verse: For I tell you that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things that you see, and have not seen them, and to hear those things that you hear, and have not heard them.

25.verse: And a certain doctor of the law stood up and tested him, saying, Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?

26.verse: Jesus said to him, What is written in the law? How do you read it?

27.verse: And he answered and said, Love your Lord God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbour as yourself.

28.verse: And Jesus said to him, You have answered right. This do, and you shall live.

29.verse: But he, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, Who then is my neighbour?

30.verse: Jesus answered and said, A certain man descended from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell into the hands of thieves who robbed him of his clothing and wounded him, and departed leaving him half dead.

31.verse: And by chance there came a certain priest that same way. And when he saw him, he passed by.

32.verse: And likewise a Levite, when he came near to the place, went and looked on him, and passed by.

33.verse: Then a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came near to him, and when he saw him had compassion on him,

34.verse: and went and bound up his wounds, and poured in oil and wine. And he put him on his own animal and brought him to a common inn, and made provision for him.

35.verse: And when he departed the next day, he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper and said to him, Take care of him; and whatever more you spend, when I come back, I will recompense you.

36.verse: Which now of these three do you think was neighbour to the man that fell into the thieves’ hands?

37.verse: And the doctor of law said, He that showed mercy on him. Then Jesus said to him, Go then and do likewise.

38.verse: It happened as they journeyed that he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

39.verse: And this woman had a sister called Mary, who sat at Jesus’ feet and heard his preaching.

40.verse: But Martha was distracted with much work of serving, and stood and said, Master, do you not care that my sister has left me to minister alone? Tell her therefore that she should help me.

41.verse: And Jesus answered and said to her, Martha, Martha, you care and are troubled about many things.

42.verse: Truly one is needful, and Mary has chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

1.verse: He teaches his disciples to pray, drives out a devil, and rebukes the blasphemous Pharisees. They require signs and tokens. He eats with the Pharisee, and reproves the hypocrisy of the Pharisees, scribes, and hypocrites. And it happened as he was praying in a certain place that when he ceased, one of his disciples said to him, Master, teach us to pray, as John taught his disciples.

2.verse: And he said to them, When you pray, say, Our Father who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, even in earth as it is in heaven.

3.verse: Give us our daily bread evermore.

4.verse: And forgive us our sins, for even we forgive every person that trespasses against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.

5.verse: And he said to them, If any of you had a friend, and went to him at midnight and said to him, Friend, lend me three loaves,

6.verse: because a friend of mine has come from a journey to me and I have nothing to set before him,

7.verse: and the man inside were to answer and say, Don’t trouble me; the door is now shut, and my servants are with me in the chamber; I cannot rise and give them to you –

8.verse: I say to you, though he would not arise and give him a loaf because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he would rise and give him as many as he needed.

9.verse: And so I say to you: ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and you shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

10.verse: For everyone that asks, receives, and he that seeks, finds, and to him who knocks, it will be opened.

11.verse: If the son asks for bread from any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for fish, will he give him a serpent for a fish?

12.verse: Or if he asks for an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

13.verse: If you then who are evil can give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father of heaven give a holy spirit to those who desire it of him?

14.verse: And he was a casting out a devil that was dumb. And it followed, when the devil was gone out, the dumb man spoke. And the people were filled with wonder.

15.verse: But some of them said, He casts out devils by the power of Beelzebub, the chief of the devils.

16.verse: And others challenged him, seeking from him a sign from heaven.

17.verse: But Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, Every kingdom divided within itself will be brought to desolation, and one house will fall upon another.

18.verse: So if Satan is divided within himself, how shall his kingdom endure? For you say that I cast out devils by the power of Beelzebub.

19.verse: If I cast out devils by the power of Beelzebub, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

20.verse: But if I with the finger of God cast out devils, without question the kingdom of God has come upon you.

21.verse: When a strong man armed guards his house, that which he possesses is in peace.

22.verse: But when one stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes from him his weapons in which he trusted, and divides up his goods.

23.verse: He who is not with me, is against me. And he who does not gather with me, scatters.

24.verse: When the unclean spirit has gone out of a man, he walks through waterless places, seeking rest. And when he finds none, he says, I will return again to my house from which I came out.

25.verse: And when he comes back, he finds it swept and set in order.

26.verse: Then he goes and gets seven other spirits worse than himself, and they enter in and dwell there, and the end of that man is worse than the beginning.

27.verse: And it happened, as he spoke those things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice and said to him, Happy is the womb that bore you, and the paps that gave you suck.

28.verse: But he said, Yea, happy are those who hear the word of God and keep it.

29.verse: When the people were gathered thick together, he began and said, This is an evil nation. They seek a sign, but no sign will be given to them except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

30.verse: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of man be to this nation.

31.verse: The queen of the south will rise at the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the end of the world to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

32.verse: The men of Nineveh will rise at the judgment with this generation and condemn them, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.

33.verse: No man lights a candle and puts it in a concealed place, nor under a bushel, but on a candlestick, so that those who come in may see the light.

34.verse: The light of your body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is single, then is all your body full of light. But if your eye is bad, then shall all your body be full of darkness.

35.verse: Take heed therefore that the light which is in you be not darkness.

36.verse: For if all your body is lighted, having no part dark, then shall all be full of light, even as when a candle lights you with its brightness.

37.verse: And as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him to dine with him, and Jesus went in and sat down to food.

38.verse: When the Pharisee saw that, he was shocked that he had not first washed before dinner.

39.verse: And the Lord said to him, Now you Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter, but your inward parts are full of greed and wickedness.

40.verse: O foolish men, did not he who made the outside also make that which is within?

41.verse: But rather give alms of what you have, and behold, all is clean to you.

42.verse: But woe is to you Pharisees. For you tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, but pass over justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, but yet not have left the others undone.

43.verse: Woe to you, Pharisees, for you love the uppermost seats in the synagogues and greetings in the markets.

44.verse: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like graves that are not seen, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them.

45.verse: Then one of the wise men of the law answered and said to him, Teacher, by so saying, you put us to rebuke also.

46.verse: Then he said, Woe is to you also, doctors of the law. For you load men with burdens grievous to be borne, and you yourselves do not touch the packs with one of your fingers.

47.verse: Woe to you! You build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them;

48.verse: truly you bear witness that you accept the deeds of your fathers, for they killed them, and you build their sepulchres.

49.verse: Therefore the wisdom of God spoke: I will send them prophets and apostles, and some they will slay, and some persecute,

50.verse: so that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the beginning of the world, may be required of this generation,

51.verse: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the temple. Truly I say to you, it shall be required of this nation.

52.verse: Woe to you, doctors of the law, for you have taken away the key of knowledge. You yourselves did not enter in, and those who came in, you opposed.

53.verse: When he spoke this way to them, the teachers of the law and the Pharisees began to hound him, and to stop his mouth with many questions,

54.verse: laying wait for him, and attempting to catch something out of his mouth that they could use to accuse him.

1.verse: The leaven of the Pharisees. Christ strengthens his disciples against persecution, and warns them to beware of covetousness by the similitude of a certain rich man. He does not want them to hang upon earthly things, but to watch and to be ready for his coming. As there gathered together an innumerable multitude of people (insomuch that they trod on one another), he began and said to his disciples, First of all, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

2.verse: For there is nothing covered that will not be uncovered, nor hid that will not be known.

3.verse: For whatever you have spoken in darkness, that same shall be heard in the light. And that which you have spoken in the ear, even in secret places, shall be declared even on the top of the houses.

4.verse: I say to you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

5.verse: But I will show you whom you should fear: fear him who, after he has killed, has power to cast into hell. Yea, I say to you: him fear!

6.verse: Are not five sparrows bought for two copper coins? And yet not one of them is forgotten by God.

7.verse: Indeed, even the very hairs of your heads are numbered. Fear not, therefore. You are of more value than many sparrows.

8.verse: I say to you, whoever confesses me before men, him also shall the Son of man confess before the angels of God.

9.verse: And he who denies me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

10.verse: And whoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it may be forgiven him; but to him who blasphemes the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven.

11.verse: When they bring you before the synagogues, and before the rulers and officers, take no thought how or what thing to answer, or what you will say.

12.verse: For the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you ought to say.

13.verse: A man in the company said to him, Master, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.

14.verse: And he said to him, Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

15.verse: And he said to them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness. For no man’s life stands in the abundance of the things that he possesses.

16.verse: And he put forth a similitude to them, saying, The ground of a certain rich man brought forth fruits plenteously,

17.verse: and he thought in himself, saying, What should I do, since I have no room to store my fruits?

18.verse: And he said, This I will do: I will pull down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my fruits and my goods.

19.verse: And I will say to my soul, Soul, you have goods enough laid up in store for many years; take your ease; eat, drink, and be merry!

20.verse: But God said to him, You fool, this night they will call away your soul back from you. Then whose will be those things that you have laid up?

21.verse: This is how it is with him who gathers riches, but is not rich in God.

22.verse: And he spoke to his disciples: Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat; neither for your body, what you will put on.

23.verse: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.

24.verse: Consider the ravens. For they neither sow nor reap, and have neither storehouse nor barn, and yet God feeds them. How much more of value are you than the birds?

25.verse: Which of you, with taking thought, can add one cubit to his stature?
