26.verse: If you then are not able to do that which is least, why be anxious about the rest?

27.verse: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they do not labour, they do not spin, and yet I say to you that Solomon in all his royalty was not clothed like one of these.

28.verse: If God so clothes the grass that is today in the field and tomorrow will be cast into the furnace, how much more will he clothe you, O ye of little faith?

29.verse: And ask not what you shall eat or what you shall drink, neither climb up on high.

30.verse: For all such things the heathen people of the world seek for. Your Father knows that you have need of such things.

31.verse: Therefore seek the kingdom of God, and all these things will be ministered unto you.

32.verse: Fear not, little flock, for it is your Father’s pleasure to give you a kingdom.

33.verse: Sell what you have and give alms, and make yourselves pouches that won’t wear out, and treasure that won’t fail in heaven, where no thief comes or moth destroys.

34.verse: For where your treasure is, there will your hearts be also.

35.verse: Let your loins be girded about and your lights burning,

36.verse: and you yourselves like men waiting for their master, for when he will return from a wedding, so that as soon as he comes and knocks, they can open to him.

37.verse: Happy are those servants whom the Lord, when he comes, finds watching. Truly I say to you, he will gird himself about and make them sit down to food, and walk by and minister to them.

38.verse: And if he comes in the second watch, yea if he comes in the third watch, and finds them so, happy are those servants.

39.verse: This understand: if the householder knew what hour the thief would come, he would surely watch, and not allow his house to be broken into.

40.verse: Be prepared therefore, for the Son of man will come at an hour when you think not.

41.verse: Then Peter said to him, Master, do you speak this similitude to us, or to all men?

42.verse: And the Lord said, If there be any servant faithful and wise, whom his lord appoints over his household to give them their portion of food at due season,

43.verse: happy is that servant whom his master, when he comes, finds so doing.

44.verse: Of a truth I say to you, he will appoint him over all that he has.

45.verse: But if the evil servant says in his heart, My master will defer his coming, and begins to smite the menservants and maidservants, and to eat and drink and to be drunken,

46.verse: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he thinks not, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will separate him, and will give him his reward with the unbelievers.

47.verse: The servant that knew his master’s will and did not prepare himself, nor do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.

48.verse: But he who did not know, and yet committed things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. For to whom much is given, of him will much be required. And to whom men commit much, the more will they ask of him.

49.verse: I have come to send fire on earth. And what is my desire, but that it were already kindled?

50.verse: But I must be baptized with a baptism – and how I am pained till it be ended!

51.verse: Do you suppose that I have come to send peace on earth? I tell you no, but rather division.

52.verse: For from henceforth there will be five in one house, divided three against two, and two against three.

53.verse: The father will be divided against the son, and the son against the father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against the mother; the mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

54.verse: Then he said to the people, When you see a cloud rise out of the west, straightaway you say we will have a rain shower, and so it is.

55.verse: And when you see the south wind blow, you say we will have heat, and it comes to pass.

56.verse: Hypocrites, you know how to interpret the aspect of the earth and of the sky, but why is it that you cannot interpret this present time?

57.verse: Yea, and why do you not judge for yourselves what is right?

58.verse: When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, as you are in the way, be diligent to be delivered from him, lest he bring you to the judge, and the judge commit you to the jailer, and the jailer cast you into prison.

59.verse: I tell you, you will not get out of there until you have made good the last mite.

1.verse: Of the Galileans whom Pilate slew, and of those that died in Siloam. The similitude of the fig tree. Christ heals the sick woman. The parables of the mustard seed and leaven. Few enter into the kingdom. Christ reproves Herod and Jerusalem. There were present at that same time people who told him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate mingled with their own sacrifice.

2.verse: And Jesus answered and said to them, Do you suppose these Galileans were greater sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such punishment?

3.verse: I tell you no, but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.

4.verse: Or those eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell and slew them, do you think they were sinners above all who dwell in Jerusalem?

5.verse: I tell you no, but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.

6.verse: He put forth this similitude: A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came and sought fruit on it, and found none.

7.verse: Then he said to the dresser of his vineyard, Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none. Cut it down. Why is it taking up space on the ground?

8.verse: And he answered and said to him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I dig round about it and dung it to see whether it will bear fruit.

9.verse: And if it does not bear then, after that cut it down.

10.verse: And he taught in one of their synagogues on the Sabbath days.

11.verse: And behold, there was a woman who had had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years, and was stooped over, and could not lift herself up at all.

12.verse: When Jesus saw her, he called her to him and said to her, Woman, you are delivered from your disease.

13.verse: And he laid his hands on her, and immediately she was made straight and glorified God.

14.verse: But the leader of the synagogue responded with indignation because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath day, and he said to the people, There are six days in which men ought to work; in them come and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.

15.verse: Then the Lord answered him and said, Hypocrite, does not each one of you on the Sabbath day loose his ox or his donkey from the stall and lead it to the water?

16.verse: And ought not this daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound now eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day?

17.verse: And when he said this, all his adversaries were ashamed. But all the people rejoiced for all the tremendous deeds that were done by him.

18.verse: Then he said, What is the kingdom of God like? or to what shall I compare it?

19.verse: Is is like a grain of mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden; and it grew, and developed into a great tree, and the birds of the air made nests in its branches.

20.verse: And again he said, To what may I liken the kingdom of God?

21.verse: It is like leaven that a woman took and hid in three bushels of flour until it was leavened right through.

22.verse: And he went through all manner of cities and towns, teaching and journeying towards Jerusalem.

23.verse: Then someone said to him, Lord, are there few that will be saved? And he said to them,

24.verse: Strive with yourselves to enter in at the strait gate. For many, I say to you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able.

25.verse: When the master of the house has risen up and has shut the door to, you all will begin to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us! And he will answer and say to you, I know you not, where you are from.

26.verse: Then you will begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in your presence, and you have taught in our streets.

27.verse: And he will say, I tell you, I do not know you, where you are from; depart from me, all you workers of iniquity!

28.verse: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and yourselves thrust out at the doors.

29.verse: And people will come from the east and from the west, and from the north and from the south, and will sit down in the kingdom of God.

30.verse: And behold, there are last who will be first, and there are first who will be last.

31.verse: That same day, certain of the Pharisees came and said to him, Get yourself out of the way, and depart from here, because Herod wants to kill you.

32.verse: And he said to them, Go and tell that fox, behold, I cast out devils and heal the people today and tomorrow, and the third day I make an end of it.

33.verse: Nevertheless, I must be going on my way today and tomorrow and the day following, for it cannot be that a prophet should perish anywhere other than at Jerusalem.

34.verse: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together, like the hen gathers her nest under her wings! But you would not.

35.verse: Behold, your habitation shall be left to you desolate. For I tell you, you will not see me until the time comes that you say, Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord.

1.verse: Jesus eats with the Pharisee, heals a man with dropsy on the Sabbath, teaches to be lowly, tells of the great supper, and warns people who would follow him to first determine what it will cost them. The salt of the earth. And it happened that he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on a Sabbath day, and they were watching him.

2.verse: And there was before him a man who had the dropsy.

3.verse: And Jesus addressed the wise men of law and the Pharisees, asking, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?

4.verse: But they held their peace. And he took the man and healed him, and let him go.

5.verse: And he spoke to them, saying, Which of you, having a donkey or an ox fallen into a pit, would not straightaway pull him out on the Sabbath day?

6.verse: And they could not answer him in reply to that.

7.verse: He put forth a similitude to the guests, when he observed how they sought out the seats of honour, and said to them,

8.verse: When you are invited to a wedding by anyone, do not sit down in the highest place, lest a more honourable man than you be bidden by him,

9.verse: and he who invited both him and you come and say to you, Make place for this man – and you then begin with shame to take the lowest seat.

10.verse: But rather, when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest seat, so that when he who invited you comes, he may say to you, Friend, sit up higher. Then you will have honour in the presence of those who sit at food with you.

11.verse: For whoever exalts himself will be brought low, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.

12.verse: Then he said also to the man who had asked him to dinner, When you give a dinner or a supper, do not call your friends or your brethren, neither your kinsfolk or rich neighbours, lest they return the invitation and a recompense be made you.

13.verse: But when you put on a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, and the blind,

14.verse: and you will be happy; for they cannot recompense you, but you shall be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.

15.verse: When one of those who sat at food also heard that, he said to Jesus, Happy is he who eats bread in the kingdom of God!

16.verse: Then Jesus said to him, A certain man prepared a great supper and invited many people.

17.verse: And he sent his servant at supper time to say to those who were bidden, Come, for all things are now ready.

18.verse: And they all at once began to make excuse. The first said to him, I have bought a farm, and I need to go and see it; I pray you, have me excused.

19.verse: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen and I’m going to inspect them; I pray you, have me excused.

20.verse: The third said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

21.verse: And the servant went and brought his master word of this. Then was the lord of the house displeased, and said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and quarters of the city, and bring in here the poor and the maimed and the lame and the blind.

22.verse: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as you ordered, and still there is room.

23.verse: And the lord said to the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel the people to come in, so that my house may be filled.

24.verse: For I say to you that none of those men that were bidden shall taste of my supper.

25.verse: A great number of people went with Jesus, and he turned and said to them,

26.verse: If a person comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, wife, and children, and brethren and sisters, and moreover his own life, he cannot be my disciple.

27.verse: And whoever does not bear his cross and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

28.verse: Which of you, thinking of building a tower, would not sit down first and count the cost, whether he has sufficient to complete it?–

29.verse: lest after he has laid the foundation and is not able to complete it, all who see it begin to mock him,

30.verse: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish it.

31.verse: Or, what king goes to make battle against another king, and does not sit down first and cast in his mind whether he is able with 10,000 to meet him who comes against him with 20,000?

32.verse: If not, while the other is yet a great way off, he will send ambassadors and seek peace.

33.verse: So now then, none of you who will not renounce all that he has can be my disciple.

34.verse: Salt is good. But if salt has lost her saltness, what can be seasoned with it?

35.verse: It is neither good for the land, nor yet for the dunghill, but men cast it out at the doors. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

1.verse: The loving mercy of God is openly seen in the parables of the hundredth sheep and of the son that was lost. Then all the publicans and sinners sought him out, in order to hear him.

2.verse: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, He receives sinners into his company, and eats with them.

3.verse: Then Jesus put forth this similitude to them, saying,

4.verse: What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he loses one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the countryside and go after the one that is lost until he finds him?

5.verse: And when he has found him, he puts him on his shoulders with joy.

6.verse: And as soon as he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbours, saying to them, Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep that was lost!

7.verse: I say to you that likewise there will be joy in heaven over one sinner that repents more than over ninety-nine just persons who need no repentance.

8.verse: Or what woman who has ten drachmas, if she loses one, does not light a lamp, and sweep the house, and search diligently till she finds it?

9.verse: And when she has found it, she calls her friends and her neighbours, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma that I had lost.

10.verse: Likewise I say to you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repents.

11.verse: And he said, A certain man had two sons,

12.verse: and the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the part of the goods that belongs to me. And he divided the substance of his wealth between them.

13.verse: And not long after, the younger son gathered all that he had together, and took his journey into a far country. And there he wasted his goods with riotous living.

14.verse: And when he had spent all that he had, there arose a great dearth throughout all that same land, and he began to be in want.

15.verse: And he went and attached himself to a citizen of that same country, who sent him to his field to keep his swine.

16.verse: And he would gladly have filled his belly with the pods that the swine ate, but no man gave to him.

17.verse: Then he came to himself and said, How many hired servants at my father’s have bread enough, and I am dying of hunger?

18.verse: I will arise and go to my father, and will say to him, Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you,

19.verse: and am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants.

20.verse: And he arose and went to his father. And when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him.

21.verse: And the son said to him, Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight, and am no longer worthy to be called your son.

22.verse: But his father said to his servants, Bring forth that best garment and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.

23.verse: And bring here the fatted calf and kill it, and let us eat and be merry.

24.verse: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is now found. And they began to be merry.

25.verse: The elder brother was in the field, and when he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing,

26.verse: and called one of his servants and asked what those things meant.

27.verse: And the servant said to him, Your brother is come, and your father had the fatted calf killed, because he has received him safe and sound.

28.verse: And the elder brother was angry and would not go in. Then his father came out and entreated him.

29.verse: He answered and said to his father, Lo, these many years I have served you, and not once broken your commandment, and yet you never gave me so much as a kid to make merry with my friends.

30.verse: But as soon as this your son comes, who has devoured your goods with harlots, you have for his pleasure killed the fatted calf!

31.verse: And the father said to him, Son, you were always with me, and all that I have is yours.

32.verse: It was right to make merry and be glad, for this your brother was dead, and is alive again, and was lost, and is found.

1.verse: The parable of the wicked mammon. Not one tittle of God’s word shall perish. Of the rich man and poor Lazarus. And he said also to his disciples, There was a certain rich man who had a steward that was accused of wasting his goods.

2.verse: And he summoned him and said to him, How is it that I hear this of you? Give accounts of your stewardship, for you may no longer be steward.

3.verse: The steward said within himself, What can I do? For my master will take away from me the stewardship. I cannot dig, and to beg I am ashamed.

4.verse: I know what to do, so that when I am put out of the stewardship, people may receive me into their houses.

5.verse: Then he called all his master’s debtors, and said to the first, How much do you owe to my master?

6.verse: And he said, A hundred tons of oil. And the steward said to him, Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.

7.verse: Then he said to another, What do you owe? And he said, A hundred quarters of wheat. The steward said to him, Take your bill and write eighty.

8.verse: And the lord commended the unjust steward because he had done wisely. For among their own, the children of this world are wiser than the children of light.

9.verse: And I say also to you, make friends for yourselves with the wicked mammon, so that when you depart this world, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

10.verse: He who is faithful in that which is least, the same is faithful in much. And he who is unfaithful in the least is unfaithful also in much.

11.verse: So then, if you have not been faithful in the wicked mammon, who will believe you in that which is true?

12.verse: And if you have not been faithful in another man’s business, who will give you your own?

13.verse: No servant can serve two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will lean to the one and neglect the other. You cannot serve both God and mammon.

14.verse: All these things the Pharisees also heard, who were covetous; and they mocked him.

15.verse: And he said to them, You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is highly esteemed among men, is abominable in the sight of God.

16.verse: The law and the prophets reigned until the time of John; and since that time, the kingdom of God is preached, and everyone strives to go in.

17.verse: Sooner can heaven and earth perish, than one tittle of the law can pass away.

18.verse: Whosoever forsakes his wife and marries another, breaks matrimony, and every man who marries her that is divorced from her husband, commits adultery also.

19.verse: There was a certain rich man that was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared deliciously every day.

20.verse: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus who lay at his gate, full of sores,

21.verse: longing to be relieved of hunger with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table. Nevertheless, the dogs came and licked his sores.

22.verse: And it came to pass that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried;

23.verse: and being in hell, in torments, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

24.verse: And he cried out and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus so that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue! For I am tormented in this flame.

25.verse: But Abraham said to him, Son, remember that you in your lifetime received your pleasure, and contrariwise Lazarus pain. Now therefore he is comforted, and you are punished.

26.verse: Beyond all this, between all you and us there is a great space set, so that those who would desire to go from here to you cannot, and none may come from there to us.

27.verse: Then he said, I pray you therefore, Father, send him to my father’s house,

28.verse: for I have five brethren, to warn them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

29.verse: Abraham said to him, They have Moses and the prophets. Let them hear them.

30.verse: And he said, Nay, Father Abraham, but if one came to them from the dead, they would repent.

31.verse: He said to him, If they do not hear Moses and the prophets, neither will they believe though one rose from death again.

1.verse: Christ teaches his disciples to avoid occasions of evil, to forgive one another, steadfastly to trust in God, and that no one should presume in his own works. He heals the ten lepers, and speaks of the latter days, and of the end of the world. Then Jesus said to his disciples, It cannot be avoided but that offences will come. Nevertheless, woe be to him through whom they come.

2.verse: It would be better for him that a millstone were hung about his neck and that he were cast into the sea, than that he should hurt one of these little ones.

3.verse: Take heed to yourselves. If your brother trespasses against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.

4.verse: And even if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turns again to you saying, I am sorry – forgive him.

5.verse: And the apostles said to the Lord, Increase our faith.

6.verse: And the Lord said, If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, and were to say to this sycamine tree, Pluck yourself up by the roots and plant yourself in the sea, it would obey you.

7.verse: Who among you, if he had a servant plowing or feeding sheep, would say to him when he came in from the field, Go quickly, and sit down to food?

8.verse: And not rather say to him, Prepare for me to sup, and gird yourself up, and serve me till I have eaten and drunk, and afterward you shall eat and drink?

9.verse: Does he thank that servant because he did that which was commanded of him? I think not.

10.verse: So likewise you, when you have done all the things that are commanded of you, say, We are unprofitable servants; we have done that which was our duty to do.

11.verse: And it so was that, as he journeyed to Jerusalem, he passed through Samaria and Galilee.

12.verse: And as he entered into a certain town, there met him ten men that were lepers, who stood afar off,

13.verse: and put forth their voices and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!

14.verse: When he saw them, he said to them, Go and show yourselves to the priests. And it came to pass that as they went, they were cleansed.

15.verse: And one of them, when he saw that he was cleansed, turned back again and with a loud voice praised God,

16.verse: and fell down on his face at Jesus’ feet, and gave him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.

17.verse: And Jesus answered and said, Were there not ten cleansed? But where are the other nine?

18.verse: There are not found any that returned again to give God praise, save only this stranger.

19.verse: And he said to the man, Arise and go your way; your faith has made you whole.

20.verse: When he was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God does not come with watching for it.

21.verse: Neither may men say, See here, look there! For behold, the kingdom of God is within you.

22.verse: And he said to the disciples, The days will come when you will desire to see one day of the Son of man, and you will not see it.

23.verse: And they will say to you, See here, see there! Do not go after them or follow them.

24.verse: For as the lightning that appears out of the one part of the heaven and shines to the other part of heaven, so shall the Son of man be in his days.

25.verse: But first he must suffer many things, and be refused by this nation.

26.verse: As it happened in the time of Noah, so shall it be in the time of the Son of man:

27.verse: they ate, they drank, they married wives, and were married, right up to the same day that Noah went into the ark; and the flood came and destroyed them all.

28.verse: Likewise also as it happened in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.

29.verse: And even the same day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them all.

30.verse: After these examples shall it be in the day when the Son of man appears.

31.verse: At that day, let him who is on the housetop, with his stuff in the house, not come down to take it out. And likewise, let not him who is in the fields turn back again to what he left behind.

32.verse: Remember Lot’s wife.

33.verse: Whosoever would go about to save his life, shall lose it, and whosoever will lose his life, shall save it.

34.verse: I tell you, in that night there will be two in one bed; the one will be received, and the other will be left.

35.verse: Two will also be a-grinding together; the one will be received, and the other left.

37.verse: And they answered and said to him, Where Lord? And he said to them, Wherever the body is, there will the eagles resort.

1.verse: He teaches to be fervent in prayer continually. Of the Pharisee and the publican. The kingdom of God belongs to children. Christ answers the ruler, and promises reward to all who suffer loss for his sake and follow him. The blind man is restored to his sight. And he put forth a similitude to them signifying that people ought always to pray, and not to be weary of it,

2.verse: saying, There was a judge in a certain city who neither feared God nor regarded man. And there was a certain widow in the same city, who came to him,

3.verse: saying, Avenge me of my adversary!

4.verse: And he would not for a while. But afterward he said to himself, Though I do not fear God or care about people,

5.verse: yet because this widow is troubling me, I will avenge her, lest she wear me out with nagging.

6.verse: And the Lord said, Hear what the unrighteous judge says.

7.verse: And will God not avenge his elect who cry day and night to him – yea, though he defer them?

8.verse: I tell you, he will avenge them, and that quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of man comes, do you suppose he will find faith on the earth?

9.verse: And he put forth this similitude to certain people who trusted in themselves, that they were righteous, and despised others:

10.verse: Two men went up into the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee and the other a publican.

11.verse: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus within himself: God, I thank you that I am not like other men are: extortioners, unjust, adulterers – or like this publican.

12.verse: I fast twice in the week; I give tithes of all that I possess.

13.verse: But the publican stood afar off, and would not lift up his eyes to heaven, but smote his breast, saying, God be merciful to me, a sinner.

14.verse: I tell you, this man departed home to his house justified more than the other. For everyone who exalts himself will be brought low, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.

15.verse: They brought to him also babes, so that he could touch them. When his disciples saw that, they rebuked the people.

16.verse: But Jesus called them to him and said, Allow the children to come to me, and do not forbid them. For of such is the kingdom of God.

17.verse: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child, he shall not enter therein.

18.verse: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what ought I to do to obtain eternal life?

19.verse: Jesus said to him, Why do you call me good? None is good, save God only.

20.verse: You know the commandments: You shall not commit adultery, you shall not kill, you shall not steal, you shall not bear false witness, honour your father and your mother.

21.verse: And he said, All these I have kept from my youth.

22.verse: When Jesus heard that, he said to him, You lack yet one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, and follow me.

23.verse: When the man heard that, he was downcast, for he was very rich.

24.verse: When Jesus saw him grieve, he said, With what difficulty do those who have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

26.verse: Then said those who heard that, And who then can be saved?

27.verse: And he said, Things that are impossible with men, are possible with God.

28.verse: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left everything and have followed you.

29.verse: And he said to them, Truly I say to you, there is no man who leaves house, or father and mother, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,

30.verse: who will not receive much more in this world, and in the world to come, everlasting life.

31.verse: He took the twelve and said to them, Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all things will be fulfilled that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man.

32.verse: He will be delivered to the Gentiles, and will be mocked, and will be despitefully abused, and will be spit upon.

33.verse: And when they have scourged him, they will put him to death. And the third day, he will arise again.

34.verse: But they understood none of these things. This saying was hid from them, and they could not perceive the things that were spoken.

35.verse: And it came to pass, as he came near to Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the wayside, begging.

36.verse: And when he heard the people pass by, he asked what it meant.

37.verse: And they said to him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.

38.verse: And he called out, saying, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!

39.verse: And the people who were in front admonished him to hold his peace. But he cried all the more, Son of David, have mercy on me!

40.verse: And Jesus stood still, and directed him to be brought to him. And when he had come near, Jesus asked him, saying,

41.verse: What do you want me to do for you? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight!

42.verse: Jesus said to him, Receive your sight; your faith has saved you.

43.verse: And immediately he saw, and followed him, praising God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave laud to God.

1.verse: Of Zaccheus, and of the ten servants to whom the minas were delivered. Christ rides to Jerusalem and weeps over it. And he entered in and went through Jericho.

2.verse: And there was a man named Zaccheus, who was a chief publican, and was rich also.

3.verse: And he made efforts to see Jesus, who he was. But due to the press of people, he could not, because he was of a low stature.

4.verse: And so he ran ahead and climbed up into a wild fig tree in order to see him, for he would be coming that way.

5.verse: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him, Zacche, come down at once, for today I must stay at your house.

6.verse: And he came down hastily, and brought him home joyfully.

7.verse: And when the people saw that, they all murmured, saying, He has gone in to stay with a man that is a sinner.

8.verse: And Zacche stood forth and said to the Lord, Behold, Lord: half of my goods I give to the poor, and if I have done any man wrong, I will restore him fourfold.

9.verse: And Jesus said to him, This day salvation has come to this house, seeing that he also has become the child of Abraham.

10.verse: For the Son of man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.

11.verse: As the people listened to these things, he added a similitude, because he was nearing Jerusalem, and also because they thought that the kingdom of God would shortly appear.

12.verse: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive a kingdom for himself, and then to return.

13.verse: And he called his ten servants and gave them ten minas, saying to them, Trade with these till I come.

14.verse: But his citizens hated him and sent messengers after him, saying, We will not have this man to reign over us.

15.verse: And it came to pass, when the nobleman returned and had received his kingdom, he commanded those servants to whom he had given his money to be called to him, to find out how each had done.

16.verse: Then came the first, saying, Lord, your mina has increased ten minas.

17.verse: And he said to him, Well done, good servant; because you were faithful in a very little thing, you shall have authority over ten cities.

18.verse: And the other came, saying, Lord, your mina has increased five minas.

19.verse: And to him he said, You also shall be over five cities.

20.verse: And the third came and said, Lord, here is your mina, which I have kept in a napkin.

21.verse: For I feared you, because you are a hard man. You take where you did not invest, and reap what you did not sow.

22.verse: And his lord said to him, By your own mouth I judge you, you evil servant. You knew that I am a hard man, taking where I did not invest and reaping what I did not sow?

23.verse: Why then didn’t you put my money into the bank, so that at my coming I could have claimed what is my own with profit?

24.verse: And he said to those who stood by, Take from him that mina, and give it the one who has ten minas.

25.verse: And they said to him, Lord, he has ten minas!

26.verse: I say to you that to all those who have, it will be given, and from him who has not, even that which he has will be taken from him.

27.verse: Moreover, those my enemies who did not want me to reign over them, bring them here and slay them before me.

28.verse: And when Jesus had thus spoken, he went on ahead, ascending up to Jerusalem.

29.verse: And it so was, when he came near Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

30.verse: saying, Go into the town which is in front of you, in which, as soon as you enter, you will find a colt tied, on which no man ever yet sat. Untie him and bring him here.

31.verse: And if anyone asks you why you are untying him, thus say to him: The Lord has need of him.

32.verse: Those who were sent went their way and found it just as he had said to them.

33.verse: And as they were untying the colt, the owners said to them, Why are you untying the colt?

34.verse: And they said, Because the Lord has need of him.

35.verse: And they brought him to Jesus. And they cast their cloaks on the colt and set Jesus thereon.

36.verse: And as he went, people spread their cloaks in the way.

37.verse: And when he came now to where he was to descend from the Mount of Olives, the whole number of the disciples began to rejoice, and to laud God with a loud voice for all the miracles that they had seen,

38.verse: saying, Blessed be the king that comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!

39.verse: And some of the Pharisees in the company said to him, Teacher, rebuke your disciples.

40.verse: He answered and said to them, I tell you, if these held their peace, the stones would cry out.

41.verse: And when he came near, he beheld the city and wept on it,

42.verse: saying, If only you had known those things that belong to your peace, at this your very time! But now they are hid from your eyes.

43.verse: For the days will come upon you that your enemies will cast up a siege-mound about you, and compass you around, and hem you in on every side,

44.verse: and lay you level with the ground, with your children who are in you. And they will not leave in you one stone upon another, because you did not acknowledge the time of your visitation.

45.verse: And he went into the temple and began to cast out those who sold therein, and those who bought,

46.verse: saying to them, It is written: My house is the house of prayer. But you have made it a den of thieves.

47.verse: And he taught daily in the temple. The high priests and the scribes and the chief men of the people went about to destroy him, but could not find what to do,

48.verse: because all the people stayed close by him, and listened attentively to him.

1.verse: They ask Christ one question, and he asks them another. The parable of the vineyard. Of tribute to be given to Caesar, and how Christ stops the mouths of the Sadducees. And it happened in one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, the high priests and the scribes came with the elders

2.verse: and spoke to him, saying, Tell us by what authority you do these things. Or who is it that gave you this authority?

3.verse: He answered and said to them, I also will ask you a question, and answer me.

4.verse: The baptism of John: was it from heaven, or of men?

5.verse: And they thought within themselves, saying, If we say from heaven, he will say, Why then did you not believe him?

6.verse: But if we say of men, all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John is a prophet.

7.verse: And they answered that they did not know where it was from.

8.verse: And Jesus said to them, Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

9.verse: Then he began and put forth to the people this similitude: A certain man planted a vineyard and let it out to farmers, and went himself into a far country for a great season.

10.verse: And when the time came, he sent a servant to his tenants, so that they would give him some of the fruits of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.

11.verse: And again he sent yet another servant. And they beat him and grievously used him also, and sent him away empty-handed.

12.verse: Moreover he sent a third too, and him they wounded and cast out.

13.verse: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my dear son; him perhaps they will respect, when they see him.

14.verse: But when the farmers saw him, they thought in themselves, saying, This is the heir; come, let us kill him so that the inheritance can be ours.

15.verse: And they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him. Now, what will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will let out his vineyard to others. When they heard that, they said, God forbid!

17.verse: And he looked upon them and said, What then does this mean that is written: The stone that the builders refused, the same is made the head cornerstone;

18.verse: whosoever stumbles at that stone will be broken, but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder?

19.verse: And the high priests and the scribes in that same hour went about to lay hands on him, but they feared the people. For they perceived that he had spoken this similitude against them.

20.verse: And they watched him, and sent forth spies who would pretend to be sincere, to take him in his words, and to deliver him to the power and authority of the governor.

21.verse: And they asked him, saying, Teacher, we know that you say and teach right, and do not consider any man’s degree, but teach the way of God truly.

22.verse: Is it lawful for us to pay tribute to Caesar, or no?

23.verse: He perceived their craftiness and said to them, Why do you bait me?

24.verse: Show me a denarius. Whose image and superscription does it have? They answered and said, Caesar’s.

25.verse: And he said to them, Give then to Caesar that which belongs to Caesar, and to God that which belongs to God.

26.verse: And they could not reprove his saying before the people. But they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

27.verse: Then there came to him certain of the Sadducees, who deny that there is any resurrection.

28.verse: And they asked him, saying, Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if any man’s brother dies, leaving a wife but no issue, then his brother should take his wife and raise up seed for his brother.

29.verse: There were seven brethren, and the first took a wife, and died without children.

30.verse: And the second took the wife, but he died childless.

31.verse: And the third took her, and so on likewise the rest of the seven, leaving no children behind them, and died.

32.verse: Last of all, the woman died also.

33.verse: Now at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the brothers? For seven had her as wife.

34.verse: Jesus answered and said to them, The children of this world marry and are married,

35.verse: but those who will be made worthy to enjoy that world, and the resurrection from death, neither marry, nor are married,

36.verse: nor yet can die any more. For they are like the angels, and are the sons of God, inasmuch as they are the children of the resurrection.

37.verse: And that the dead shall rise again, even Moses signified in his account of the bush, when he calls the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

38.verse: For he is not the God of the dead, but of the living. For all live in him.

39.verse: Then certain of the Pharisees answered and said, Teacher, you have well said.

40.verse: And after that they dared not ask him any question at all.

41.verse: Then he said to them, How is it they say that Christ is David’s son?

42.verse: And David himself says in the book of the Psalms, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit on my right hand,

43.verse: till I make your enemies your footstool.

44.verse: Seeing David calls him Lord, how is he then his son?

45.verse: Then, in the hearing of all the people, Jesus said to his disciples,

46.verse: Beware of the scribes, who desire to go around in long clothing, and love greetings in the markets, the highest seats in the synagogues, and the places of honour at feasts;

47.verse: who devour widows’ houses, and that under a colour of long praying. The same shall receive greater damnation.

1.verse: Christ commends the poor widow. He tells of the destruction of Jerusalem, of false teachers, of the signs and troubles to come, of the end of the world, and of his own coming. As he looked on, he saw the rich, how they cast their offerings into the treasury.

2.verse: And he saw also a certain poor widow who cast in two small coins,

3.verse: and he said, Of a truth I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.

4.verse: For they all have added to the offering to God out of their surplus, but she, of her penury, has cast in all the substance that she had.

5.verse: When some were speaking about the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and jewels, Jesus said,

6.verse: The days will come when of these things that you see, there will not be left stone upon stone that shall not be thrown down.

7.verse: And they asked him, saying, Teacher, when will these things be? And what sign will there be when such things are about to happen?

8.verse: And he said, Take heed that you be not deceived. For many will come in my name, saying, I am he. And the time draws near. You must not follow them therefore.

9.verse: But when you hear of war and dissension, do not be afraid. For these things must come first. But the end will not follow immediately.

10.verse: Then he said to them, Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

11.verse: And great earthquakes will be in all quarters, and hunger and pestilence, and fearful things. And there will be great signs from heaven.

12.verse: But before all these, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and into prison, and will bring you before kings and rulers for my name’s sake.

13.verse: And this will happen to you for a testimony.

14.verse: Let it therefore stick fast in your hearts not once to concern yourselves beforehand what to answer,

15.verse: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom against which none of your adversaries will be able to speak or resist.

16.verse: Yea and you will be betrayed by your fathers and mothers, and by your brethren and kinsmen and friends, and some of you they will put to death.

17.verse: And you will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.

18.verse: Yet not one hair of your heads shall perish.

19.verse: With your patience possess your souls.

20.verse: And when you see Jerusalem besieged with a host, then understand that its desolation is near.

21.verse: Then let the people who are in Judea flee to the mountains, and let those who are in the city get out. And let not those who are in other countries enter in.

22.verse: For these are the days of vengeance, to fulfil all the things that are written.

23.verse: But woe will be to women who are with child and to those who give suck in those days, for there will be great trouble in the land, and wrath over all this people.

24.verse: And they will fall on the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all nations. And Jerusalem will be trodden under foot by the Gentiles, until the time of the Gentiles is fulfilled.

25.verse: And there will be signs in the sun and in the moon and in the stars, and in the earth the people will be in such perplexity that they will not know which way to turn. The sea and the waters will roar,

26.verse: and men’s hearts will fail them for fear, and for the dread of those things which shall come on the earth. For the powers of heaven shall move.

27.verse: And then shall they see the Son of man come in a cloud, with power and great glory.

28.verse: When these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads, for your redemption draws near.

29.verse: And he told them a similitude: Consider the fig tree, and all other trees.

30.verse: When they shoot forth their buds, you see and can tell for your own selves that summer is then nigh at hand.

31.verse: So likewise, when you see these things come to pass, understand that the kingdom of God is near.

32.verse: Truly I say to you, this generation shall not pass till all be fulfilled.

33.verse: Heaven and earth shall pass, but my words shall not pass.

34.verse: Take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts be overcome with excess of eating, and drunkenness, and worldly cares, and that day come on you unawares.

35.verse: For as a snare shall it come upon all who sit on the face of the earth.

36.verse: Watch therefore continually, and pray that you may obtain grace to escape all this that is to come, and that you may stand before the Son of man.

37.verse: In the daytime he taught in the temple, and at night he went out and stayed on the Mount of Olives.

38.verse: And all the people came to him in the morning in the temple, to hear him.

1.verse: Christ is betrayed. They eat the Passover lamb. The institution of the sacrament. They dispute who should be greatest; he reproves them. He prays three times upon the mount. They seize him and bring him to the high priest’s house. Peter denies him three times, and they bring Jesus before the council. The feast of sweet bread drew near, which is called the Passover.

2.verse: And the high priests and scribes were seeking how to kill Jesus, but they feared the people.

3.verse: Then Satan entered into Judas, whose surname was Iscariot (who was of the number of the twelve),

4.verse: and he went his way and communed with the high priests and officers, how he might betray Jesus to them.

5.verse: And they were glad, and promised to give him money.

6.verse: And he accepted, and sought an opportunity to betray Jesus to them when the people were away.

7.verse: Then came the day of sweet bread, when of necessity the Passover lamb must be offered.

8.verse: And Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare for us the Passover lamb so that we may eat.

9.verse: They said to him, Where would you like us to prepare it?

10.verse: And he said to them, When you have entered into the city, there a man bearing a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the same house that he enters in,

11.verse: and say to the head of the house, The Master says to you, where is the guest chamber, where I may eat my Passover lamb with my disciples?

12.verse: And he will show you a large upper room furnished. There make ready.

13.verse: And they went and found things as he had said to them, and made ready the Passover lamb.

14.verse: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

15.verse: And he said to them, I have inwardly desired to eat this Passover lamb with you before I suffer.

16.verse: For I say to you, henceforth I will not eat of it any more until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

17.verse: And he took the cup and gave thanks and said, Take this, and divide it among you.

18.verse: For I say to you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God has come.

19.verse: And he took bread, gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, This is my body, which is given for you. This do in the remembrance of me.

20.verse: Likewise also, when they had supped, he took the cup, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood, which shall be shed for you.

21.verse: Yet behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.

22.verse: And the Son of man goes as it is appointed; but woe be to that man by whom he is betrayed.

23.verse: And they began to enquire among themselves which of them it could be that would do that.

24.verse: And there was a dispute among them, which of them should be taken for the greatest.

25.verse: And he said to them, The kings of the Gentiles reign over them, and those who bear rule over them are called gracious lords.

26.verse: But you shall not be like this. Rather, he who is greatest among you shall be as the youngest, and he who is chief shall be as the servant.

27.verse: For who is greater: he who sits at food, or he that serves? Is it not he who sits at food? But I am among you as he that serves.

28.verse: And you are those who have stayed with me in my trials.

29.verse: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father has appointed to me,

30.verse: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit upon seats, and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold: Satan has desired you all, to sift you like wheat.

32.verse: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith should not fail. And when you have turned back again, strengthen your brethren.

33.verse: And Peter said to him, Lord, I am ready to go with you into prison, and to death.

34.verse: And he said, I tell you, Peter, the cock will not crow this day till you have three times denied that you knew me.

35.verse: And he said to them, When I sent you out without wallet or bag or shoes, did you lack anything? And they said, No.

36.verse: And he said to them, But now, let him who has a wallet take it up, and likewise his bag. And he who has no sword, let him sell his coat and buy one.

37.verse: For I say to you that that which is written must yet be performed in me: Even with the wicked was he numbered. For those things which are written of me have their fulfilment.

38.verse: And they said, Lord, see, here are two swords. And he said to them, It is enough.

39.verse: And he came out and went, as was his custom, to the Mount of  Olives. And the disciples followed him.

40.verse: And when he came to the place, he said to them, Pray, lest you fall into temptation.

41.verse: And he went apart by himself, about a stone’s throw from them, and kneeled down and prayed, saying,

42.verse: Father, if you will, withdraw this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours be fulfilled.

43.verse: And there appeared to him an angel from heaven, comforting him.

44.verse: And he was in an agony, and prayed somewhat longer. And his sweat was like drops of blood trickling down to the ground.

45.verse: And he rose up from prayer and came to his disciples, and found them sleeping for sorrow,

46.verse: and said to them, Why do you sleep? Rise and pray, lest you fall into temptation.

47.verse: While he was yet speaking, behold, there came a band of men, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. And he pressed near to Jesus to kiss him.

48.verse: And Jesus said to him, Judas, do you betray the Son of man with a kiss?

49.verse: When those who were with Jesus saw what would follow, they said to him, Lord, shall we smite with swords?

50.verse: And one of them struck a servant of the most high priest, and cut off his right ear.

51.verse: But Jesus answered and said, Let it come to this. And he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to the high priests and officers of the temple, and the elders who had approached him, Have you come out as if to a thief, with swords and clubs?

53.verse: When I was daily with you in the temple, you did not stretch forth hands against me. But this is even your very hour, and the power of darkness.

54.verse: Then they took him and led him, and brought him to the home of the high priest. And Peter followed afar off.

55.verse: When they had kindled a fire in the centre courtyard of the palace and were sitting together, Peter also sat down among them.

56.verse: And one of the servant girls saw him as he sat by the fire, and took a good look at him and said, This man was also with him.

57.verse: Then he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

58.verse: And after a little while another saw him and said, You are also one of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.

59.verse: And about the space of an hour afterwards, another affirmed, saying, Surely this fellow was with him, for he is from Galilee.

60.verse: And Peter said, Man, I don’t know what you are talking about. And immediately, while he yet spoke, the cock crew.

61.verse: And the Lord turned back and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the words of the Lord, how he said to him, Before the cock crows, you will deny me three times.

62.verse: And Peter went out and wept bitterly.

63.verse: And the men that stood about Jesus mocked him and beat him,

64.verse: and blindfolded him, and struck his face. And they asked him, saying, Prophesy! Who it is that hit you?

65.verse: And they said many other things despitefully against him.

66.verse: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the high priests and scribes came together, and they led him into their council, saying,

67.verse: Are you the very Christ? Tell us. And he said to them, If I tell you, you will not believe.

68.verse: And also if I ask you, you will not answer me or let me go.

69.verse: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

70.verse: Then they all said, Are you then the Son of God? He said to them, As you say, I am.

71.verse: Then they said, Why do we need any further testimony? We ourselves have heard from his own mouth.

1.verse: Jesus is brought before Pilate and Herod. The women make lamentation for him. He prays for his enemies, forgives the thief upon his right hand, and dies on the cross and is buried. And the whole number of them arose, and led Jesus to Pilate.

2.verse: And they began to accuse him, saying, We have found his fellow upsetting the people, and forbidding to pay tribute to Caesar, saying that he is Christ, a king.

3.verse: And Pilate questioned him, saying, Are you the king of the Jews? He answered him and said, It is as you say.

4.verse: Then Pilate said to the high priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.

5.verse: But they were all the more fierce, saying, He stirs up the people, teaching throughout Judea, beginning at Galilee, and even to this place.

6.verse: When Pilate heard mention of Galilee, he asked whether the man was from Galilee.

7.verse: And as soon as he knew he was of Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also at Jerusalem in those days.

8.verse: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad. He had desired to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him, and trusted to see some miracle done by him.

9.verse: Then he questioned him concerning many things, but Jesus answered him not one word.

10.verse: The high priests and scribes stood forth and accused him vehemently.

11.verse: And Herod with his men of war derided him and mocked him, and arrayed him in white, and sent him again to Pilate.

12.verse: And that same day, Pilate and Herod were brought together as friends. For before, they were at variance.

13.verse: And Pilate called together the high priests, the rulers, and the people,

14.verse: and said to them, You have brought this man to me as one who incited uprising among the people. But I have examined him before you, and have found no fault in this man concerning those things that you accuse him of.

15.verse: No, nor did Herod; for I sent you to him, and lo, nothing worthy of death was determined against him.

16.verse: I will therefore chastise him and let him go.

17.verse: (For custom constrained Pilate to release one prisoner to them at that feast.)

18.verse: And all the people cried out at once, saying, Away with him, and release Barabbas to us!

19.verse: (who for insurrection made in the city and for murder had been cast into prison).

20.verse: Pilate spoke again to them, wanting to let Jesus go free.

21.verse: But they shouted, saying, Crucify him! Crucify him!

22.verse: He said to them the third time, What evil has he done? I find no cause of death in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.

23.verse: But they called with loud voices for him to be crucified. And the voice of the people and of the high priests prevailed,

24.verse: and Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required,

25.verse: and released to them the one who for insurrection and murder had been cast into prison, whom they desired, and delivered Jesus to do with him what they would.

26.verse: And as they led him away, they caught one Simon of Cyrene coming out of the field, and on him they laid the cross, to bear it after Jesus.

27.verse: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which women bewailed and lamented him.

28.verse: But Jesus turned back to them and said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

29.verse: For behold, the days will come when men will say, Happy are the barren, and the wombs that never bore, and the paps that never gave suck.

30.verse: Then will they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us! and to the hills, Cover us!

31.verse: For if they do this to a green tree, what shall be done to the dry?

32.verse: And there were two evil-doers led with him to be slain.

33.verse: And when they came to the place that is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the evil-doers also, one on the right hand and the other on the left.

34.verse: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do. And they divided up his garments and cast lots for them.

35.verse: And the people stood and looked on. And the leaders mocked him with them, saying, He helped other men; let him help himself, if he is Christ, the chosen of God.

36.verse: The soldiers also mocked him, and came and gave him vinegar,

37.verse: and said, If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself.

38.verse: And a superscription was written over him in Greek, in Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

39.verse: And one of the evil-doers who hung there railed on him, saying, If you are the Christ, save yourself and us.

40.verse: But the other answered and rebuked him, saying, Do you not fear God, seeing that you are under the same sentence?

41.verse: We are rightly punished, for we receive according to our deeds, but this man has done nothing amiss.

42.verse: And he said to Jesus, Lord, remember me when you come into your kingdom.

43.verse: And Jesus said to him, Truly I say to you, today you shall be with me in Paradise.

44.verse: And it was about the sixth hour. And there came a darkness over all the land until the ninth hour,

45.verse: and the sun was darkened. And the veil of the temple did tear, right through the middle.

46.verse: And Jesus cried with a great voice and said, Father, into your hands I commit my spirit. And when he had thus spoken, he gave up the spirit.

47.verse: When the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God, saying, Surely this was a just man.

48.verse: And all the people who came together to that sight, beholding the things that were done, smote their breasts and returned home.

49.verse: And all those who knew him, and the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood afar off beholding these things.

50.verse: And there was a man named Joseph, a member of the council, and he was a good man and just.

51.verse: He had not consented to their counsel and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and he was also waiting for the kingdom of God.

52.verse: He went to Pilate and requested the body of Jesus,

53.verse: and took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid it in a tomb hewn out in stone, in which no man had ever before been laid.

54.verse: And that day was the day of preparation; and the Sabbath drew on.

55.verse: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed after, and saw the sepulchre and how his body was laid.

56.verse: And they returned and prepared spices and oyntments, but rested on the Sabbath day according to the commandment.

1.verse: The women come to the grave. Christ appears to the two disciples on their way to Emmaus, stands in the midst of his disciples, opens their understanding in the scriptures, gives them a charge, and ascends up to heaven. On the morrow after the Sabbath, early in the morning, the women went to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared and other women with them.

2.verse: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre,

3.verse: and went in, but did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: And it happened as they wondered at this, behold, two men stood by them in shining vestures.

5.verse: And as the women became afraid and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said to them, Why do you seek the living among the dead? He is not here, but is risen.

6.verse: Remember how he spoke to you when he was yet with you in Galilee,

7.verse: saying that the Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men and be crucified, and the third day rise again?

8.verse: And they remembered his words,

9.verse: and returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.

10.verse: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary Jacobi, and others that were with them, who told these things to the apostles.

11.verse: But their words seemed to them like vain things, and they did not believe them.

12.verse: Then Peter arose and ran to the sepulchre, and stooped in and saw the linen cloths laid by themselves. And he departed, wondering in himself at that which had happened.

13.verse: And behold, two of them set out that same day for a town called Emmaus, which was about sixty furlongs from Jerusalem,

14.verse: and they talked together about all these things that had happened.

15.verse: And it so was, as they conversed together and discussed, that Jesus himself drew near and went alongside them.

16.verse: But their eyes were held, so they could not know him.

17.verse: And he said to them, What sort of conversations are these that you are having with each other as you walk and are sad?

18.verse: And the one named Cleopas answered and said to him, Are you only a stranger in Jerusalem, and do not know about the things that have happened there in these days?

19.verse: Jesus said to them, What things? And they said to him, Of Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people,

20.verse: and how the high priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.

21.verse: But we trusted that it was he who would deliver Israel. And regarding all these things, today is just the third day since they happened.

22.verse: Yea, and also certain women of our company have us mystified. They went early to the sepulchre,

23.verse: but did not find his body, and came saying that they had seen a vision of angels who said that he was alive.

24.verse: And some of those who were with us went their way to the sepulchre and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see him.

25.verse: And he said to them, O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!

26.verse: Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into his glory?

27.verse: And he began at Moses and at all the prophets, and interpreted to them all the scriptures that were written about him.

28.verse: And they drew near the town they were headed to, and Jesus made as though he would have gone further.

29.verse: But they constrained him, saying, Stay with us, for it is drawing towards night and the day is far past. And he went in to stay with them.

30.verse: And it came to pass, as he sat at food with them, he took bread, blessed it, broke, and gave to them.

31.verse: And their eyes were opened and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

32.verse: And they said between themselves, Did not our hearts burn within us while he talked with us along the road and as he opened to us the scriptures?

33.verse: And they rose up the same hour and returned again to Jerusalem. And they found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,

34.verse: who said, The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!

35.verse: And the two told what things had happened along the road, and how they knew him in the breaking of bread.

36.verse: As they were thus speaking, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them and said to them, Peace be with you.

37.verse: And they were startled and afraid, supposing they saw a spirit.

38.verse: And he said to them, Why are you troubled, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?

39.verse: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is even I myself. Handle me and see. For spirits do not have flesh and bones, as you see me to have.

40.verse: And when he had thus spoken, he showed them his hands and his feet.

41.verse: And while they still could not believe for joy and wonderment, he said to them, Have you any food here?

42.verse: And they gave him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.

43.verse: And he took it and ate it before them.

44.verse: And he said to them, These are the things that I told to you while I was still with you: that all must be fulfilled that was written about me in the law of Moses, and in the Prophets, and in the Psalms.

45.verse: Then he opened their wits to understand the scriptures,

46.verse: and said to them, Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for Christ to suffer, and to rise again from death the third day,

47.verse: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, and must begin at Jerusalem.

48.verse: And you are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: And behold, I will send the promise of my Father upon you. But stay in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high.

50.verse: And he led them out into Bethany, and lifted up his hands and blessed them.

51.verse: And it came to pass, as he blessed them, he departed from them and was carried up into heaven.

52.verse: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,

53.verse: and were continually in the temple, praising and lauding God. Amen. Here ends the gospel of Saint Luke.
